pycoa.coa.display

Project : PyCoA Date : april 2020 - november 2023 Authors : Olivier Dadoun, Julien Browaeys, Tristan Beau Copyright ©pycoa.fr License: See joint LICENSE file

Module : coa.display

About :

An interface module to easily plot pycoa data with bokeh

   1# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
   2
   3"""
   4Project : PyCoA
   5Date :    april 2020 - november 2023
   6Authors : Olivier Dadoun, Julien Browaeys, Tristan Beau
   7Copyright ©pycoa.fr
   8License: See joint LICENSE file
   9
  10Module : coa.display
  11
  12About :
  13-------
  14
  15An interface module to easily plot pycoa data with bokeh
  16
  17"""
  18from coa.tools import (
  19    kwargs_test,
  20    extract_dates,
  21    verb,
  22    fill_missing_dates
  23)
  24from coa.error import *
  25from coa.dbparser import _db_list_dict
  26import math
  27import pandas as pd
  28import geopandas as gpd
  29import numpy as np
  30from collections import defaultdict
  31import itertools
  32import json
  33import io
  34from io import BytesIO
  35import base64
  36from IPython import display
  37import copy
  38import locale
  39import inspect
  40
  41from bokeh.models import (
  42    ColumnDataSource,
  43    TableColumn,
  44    DataTable,
  45    ColorBar,
  46    LogTicker,
  47    HoverTool,
  48    CrosshairTool,
  49    BasicTicker,
  50    GeoJSONDataSource,
  51    LinearColorMapper,
  52    LogColorMapper,
  53    Label,
  54    PrintfTickFormatter,
  55    BasicTickFormatter,
  56    NumeralTickFormatter,
  57    CustomJS,
  58    CustomJSHover,
  59    Select,
  60    Range1d,
  61    DatetimeTickFormatter,
  62    Legend,
  63    LegendItem,
  64    Text
  65)
  66from bokeh.models.widgets import (
  67    Tabs,
  68    Panel,
  69    Button,
  70    TableColumn,
  71    Toggle
  72)
  73from bokeh.plotting import figure
  74from bokeh.layouts import (
  75    row,
  76    column,
  77    gridplot
  78)
  79from bokeh.palettes import (
  80    Category10,
  81    Category20,
  82    Viridis256
  83)
  84from bokeh.models import Title
  85
  86from bokeh.io import export_png
  87from bokeh import events
  88from bokeh.models.widgets import DateSlider
  89from bokeh.models import (
  90    LabelSet,
  91    WMTSTileSource
  92)
  93from bokeh.transform import (
  94    transform,
  95    cumsum
  96)
  97import shapely.geometry as sg
  98
  99import branca.colormap
 100from branca.colormap import LinearColormap
 101from branca.element import (
 102    Element,
 103    Figure
 104)
 105import folium
 106from PIL import Image
 107import coa.geo as coge
 108import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 109import datetime as dt
 110import bisect
 111from functools import wraps
 112from IPython.core.display import (
 113    display,
 114    HTML
 115)
 116
 117width_height_default = [500, 380]
 118MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED = 24
 119class CocoDisplay:
 120    def __init__(self, db=None, geo = None):
 121        verb("Init of CocoDisplay() with db=" + str(db))
 122        self.database_name = db
 123        self.dbld = _db_list_dict
 124        self.lcolors = Category20[20]
 125        self.scolors = Category10[5]
 126        self.pycoageopandas = False
 127        self.ax_type = ['linear', 'log']
 128        self.geom = []
 129        self.geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame()
 130        self.location_geometry = None
 131        self.boundary_metropole = None
 132        self.listfigs = []
 133        self.options_stats  = ['when','input','input_field']
 134        self.options_charts = [ 'bins']
 135        self.options_front = ['where','option','which','what','visu']
 136        self.available_tiles = ['openstreet','esri','stamen']
 137        self.available_modes = ['mouse','vline','hline']
 138        self.uptitle, self.subtitle = ' ',' '
 139
 140        self.dfigure_default = {'plot_height':width_height_default[1] ,'plot_width':width_height_default[0],'title':None,'textcopyright':'default'}
 141        self.dvisu_default = {'mode':'mouse','tile':self.available_tiles[0],'orientation':'horizontal','cursor_date':None,'maplabel':None,'guideline':False}
 142
 143        self.when_beg = dt.date(1, 1, 1)
 144        self.when_end = dt.date(1, 1, 1)
 145
 146        self.alloptions =  self.options_stats + self.options_charts + self.options_front + list(self.dfigure_default.keys()) +\
 147                           list(self.dvisu_default.keys()) + ['resumetype']
 148
 149        self.iso3country = self.dbld[self.database_name][0]
 150        self.granularity = self.dbld[self.database_name][1]
 151        self.namecountry = self.dbld[self.database_name][2]
 152        try:
 153            if self.granularity != 'nation':
 154                self.geo = coge.GeoCountry(self.iso3country)
 155                if self.granularity == 'region':
 156                    self.location_geometry = self.geo.get_region_list()[['code_region', 'name_region', 'geometry']]
 157                    self.location_geometry = self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
 158                    if self.iso3country == 'PRT':
 159                         tmp=self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
 160                         tmp = tmp.loc[tmp.code_region=='PT.99']
 161                         self.boundary_metropole =tmp['geometry'].total_bounds
 162                    if self.iso3country == 'FRA':
 163                         tmp=self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
 164                         tmp = tmp.loc[tmp.code_region=='999']
 165                         self.boundary_metropole =tmp['geometry'].total_bounds
 166                elif self.granularity == 'subregion':
 167                    list_dep_metro = None
 168                    self.location_geometry = self.geo.get_subregion_list()[['code_subregion', 'name_subregion', 'geometry']]
 169                    self.location_geometry = self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_subregion': 'where'})
 170            else:
 171                   self.geo=coge.GeoManager('name')
 172                   geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame()#crs="EPSG:4326")
 173                   info = coge.GeoInfo()
 174                   allcountries = self.geo.get_GeoRegion().get_countries_from_region('world')
 175                   geopan['where'] = [self.geo.to_standard(c)[0] for c in allcountries]
 176                   geopan = info.add_field(field=['geometry'],input=geopan ,geofield='where')
 177                   geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame(geopan, geometry=geopan.geometry, crs="EPSG:4326")
 178                   geopan = geopan[geopan['where'] != 'Antarctica']
 179                   geopan = geopan.dropna().reset_index(drop=True)
 180                   self.location_geometry  = geopan
 181        except:
 182            raise CoaTypeError('What data base are you looking for ?')
 183
 184    ''' FIGURE COMMUN FOR ALL '''
 185    def standardfig(self, **kwargs):
 186        """
 187         Create a standard Bokeh figure, with pycoa.fr copyright, used in all the bokeh charts
 188         """
 189        plot_width = kwargs.get('plot_width', self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
 190        plot_height = kwargs.get('plot_height', self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
 191        textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', self.dfigure_default['textcopyright'])
 192
 193        if textcopyright  == 'default':
 194                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr (data from: {})'.format(self.database_name)
 195        else:
 196                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr ' + textcopyright
 197
 198        citation = Label(x=0.65 * plot_width - len(textcopyright), y=0.01 * plot_height,
 199                                          x_units='screen', y_units='screen',
 200                                          text_font_size='1.5vh', background_fill_color='white', background_fill_alpha=.75,
 201                                          text=textcopyright)
 202
 203        for i in list(self.dvisu_default.keys())  + self.options_front + self.options_charts + ['textcopyright'] + self.options_stats + ['date_slider']:
 204            if i in kwargs.keys():
 205                kwargs.pop(i)
 206        kwargs.pop('title')
 207        fig = figure(**kwargs, tools=['save', 'box_zoom,reset'], toolbar_location="right")
 208        #fig.add_layout(citation)
 209        fig.add_layout(Title(text=self.uptitle, text_font_size="10pt"), 'above')
 210        if 'innerdecomap' not in inspect.stack()[1].function:
 211            fig.add_layout(Title(text=self.subtitle, text_font_size="8pt", text_font_style="italic"), 'below')
 212        return fig
 213
 214    def get_listfigures(self):
 215        return  self.listfigs
 216
 217    def set_listfigures(self,fig):
 218            if not isinstance(fig,list):
 219                fig = [fig]
 220            self.listfigs = fig
 221    ''' WRAPPER COMMUN FOR ALL'''
 222    def decowrapper(func):
 223        '''
 224            Main decorator it mainly deals with arg testings
 225        '''
 226        @wraps(func)
 227        def wrapper(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 228            """
 229            Parse a standard input, return :
 230                - pandas: with location keyword (eventually force a column named 'where' to 'where')
 231                - kwargs:
 232                    * keys = [plot_width, plot_width, title, when, title_temporal,bins, what, which]
 233            Note that method used only the needed variables, some of them are useless
 234            """
 235            if not isinstance(input, pd.DataFrame):
 236                raise CoaTypeError(input + 'Must be a pandas, with pycoa structure !')
 237
 238            kwargs_test(kwargs, self.alloptions, 'Bad args used in the display function.')
 239            when = kwargs.get('when', None)
 240            which = kwargs.get('which', input.columns[2])
 241            if isinstance(which,list):
 242                which = input.columns[2]
 243            if input_field and 'cur_' in input_field:
 244                what =  which
 245            else:
 246                 # cumul is the default
 247                what = kwargs.get('what', which)
 248
 249            if input_field is None:
 250                input_field = which
 251
 252            if isinstance(input_field,list):
 253                test = input_field[0]
 254            else:
 255                test = input_field
 256            if input[[test,'date']].isnull().values.all():
 257                raise CoaKeyError('All values for '+ which + ' is nan nor empty')
 258
 259            if type(input)==gpd.geodataframe.GeoDataFrame:
 260               self.pycoageopandas = True
 261
 262            option = kwargs.get('option', None)
 263            bins = kwargs.get('bins', 10)
 264            title = kwargs.get('title', None)
 265            #textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', 'default')
 266            kwargs['plot_width'] = kwargs.get('plot_width', self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
 267            kwargs['plot_height'] = kwargs.get('plot_height', self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
 268
 269            if 'codelocation' and 'clustername' not in input.columns:
 270                input['codelocation'] = input['where']
 271                input['clustername'] = input['where']
 272                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
 273                input['permanentdisplay'] = input['where']
 274            else:
 275                if self.granularity == 'nation' :
 276                    #input['codelocation'] = input['codelocation'].apply(lambda x: str(x).replace('[', '').replace(']', '') if len(x)< 10 else x[0]+'...'+x[-1] )
 277                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.apply(lambda x: x.clustername if self.geo.get_GeoRegion().is_region(x.clustername) else str(x.codelocation), axis = 1)
 278                else:
 279                    if self.granularity == 'subregion' :
 280                        input = input.reset_index(drop=True)
 281                        if isinstance(input['codelocation'].iloc[0],list):
 282                            input['codelocation'] = input['codelocation'].apply(lambda x: str(x).replace("'", '')\
 283                                                         if len(x)<5 else '['+str(x[0]).replace("'", '')+',...,'+str(x[-1]).replace("'", '')+']')
 284
 285                        trad={}
 286                        cluster = input.clustername.unique()
 287                        if isinstance(input['where'].iloc[0],list):
 288                           cluster = [i for i in cluster]
 289                        for i in cluster:
 290                            if i == self.namecountry:
 291                                input['permanentdisplay'] = input.clustername #[self.dbld[self.database_name][2]]*len(input)
 292                            else:
 293                                if self.geo.is_region(i):
 294                                    trad[i] = self.geo.is_region(i)
 295                                elif self.geo.is_subregion(i):
 296                                    trad[i] = self.geo.is_subregion(i)#input.loc[input.clustername==i]['codelocation'].iloc[0]
 297                                else:
 298                                    trad[i] = i
 299                                trad={k:(v[:3]+'...'+v[-3:] if len(v)>8 else v) for k,v in trad.items()}
 300                                if ',' in input.codelocation[0]:
 301                                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.clustername
 302                                else:
 303                                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.codelocation#input.clustername.map(trad)
 304                    elif self.granularity == 'region' :
 305                        if all(i == self.namecountry for i in input.clustername.unique()):
 306                            input['permanentdisplay'] = [self.namecountry]*len(input)
 307                        else:
 308                            input['permanentdisplay'] = input.codelocation
 309                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
 310
 311            maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel', None)
 312            if maplabel and 'unsorted' in maplabel:
 313                pass
 314            else:
 315                input = input.sort_values(by=input_field, ascending = False).reset_index(drop=True)
 316
 317            uniqloc = input.clustername.unique()
 318
 319            if len(uniqloc) < 5:
 320                colors = self.scolors
 321            else:
 322                colors = self.lcolors
 323            colors = itertools.cycle(colors)
 324            dico_colors = {i: next(colors) for i in uniqloc}
 325
 326            input = input.copy()
 327            if not 'colors' in input.columns:
 328                input.loc[:,'colors'] = input['clustername'].map(dico_colors)#(pd.merge(input, country_col, on='where'))
 329
 330            if not isinstance(input_field, list):
 331                  input_field = [input_field]
 332            else:
 333                  input_field = input_field
 334            col2=which
 335            when_beg = input[[col2,'date']].date.min()
 336            when_end = input[[col2,'date']].date.max()
 337
 338            if when:
 339                when_beg, when_end = extract_dates(when)
 340                if when_end > input[[col2,'date']].date.max():
 341                    when_end = input[[col2,'date']].date.max()
 342
 343                if when_beg == dt.date(1, 1, 1):
 344                    when_beg = input[[col2,'date']].date.min()
 345
 346                if not isinstance(when_beg, dt.date):
 347                    raise CoaNoData("With your current cuts, there are no data to plot.")
 348
 349                if when_end <= when_beg:
 350                    print('Requested date below available one, take', when_beg)
 351                    when_end = when_beg
 352                if when_beg > input[[col2,'date']].date.max() or when_end > input[[col2,'date']].date.max():
 353                    raise CoaNoData("No available data after "+str(input[[input_field[0],'date']].date.max()))
 354            when_end_change = when_end
 355
 356            for i in input_field:
 357                if input[i].isnull().all():
 358                    #raise CoaTypeError("Sorry all data are NaN for " + i)
 359                    print("Sorry all data are NaN for " + i)
 360                else:
 361                    when_end_change = min(when_end_change,CocoDisplay.changeto_nonull_date(input, when_end, i))
 362
 363            if func.__name__ not in ['pycoa_date_plot', 'pycoa_plot', 'pycoa_scrollingmenu', 'pycoa_spiral_plot','pycoa_yearly_plot']:
 364                if len(input_field) > 1:
 365                    print(str(input_field) + ' is dim = ' + str(len(input_field)) + '. No effect with ' + func.__name__ + '! Take the first input: ' + input_field[0])
 366                input_field = input_field[0]
 367
 368            if when_end_change != when_end:
 369                when_end = when_end_change
 370
 371            self.when_beg = when_beg
 372            self.when_end = when_end
 373            input = input.loc[(input['date'] >=  self.when_beg) & (input['date'] <=  self.when_end)]
 374
 375            title_temporal = ' (' + 'between ' + when_beg.strftime('%d/%m/%Y') + ' and ' + when_end.strftime('%d/%m/%Y') + ')'
 376            if func.__name__ not in ['pycoa_date_plot', 'pycoa_plot', 'pycoa_scrollingmenu', 'pycoa_spiral_plot','pycoa_yearly_plot']:
 377                title_temporal = ' (' + when_end.strftime('%d/%m/%Y')  + ')'
 378            title_option=''
 379            if option:
 380                if 'sumallandsmooth7' in option:
 381                    if not isinstance(option,list):
 382                        option = ['sumallandsmooth7']
 383                    option.remove('sumallandsmooth7')
 384                    option += ['sumall','smooth7']
 385                title_option = ' (option: ' + str(option)+')'
 386
 387            input_field_tostring = str(input_field).replace('[', '').replace(']', '').replace('\'', '')
 388            whichtitle = which
 389            if 'pop' in input_field_tostring:
 390                whichtitle = input_field_tostring.replace('weekly ','').replace('daily ','')
 391
 392            if 'daily' in input_field_tostring:
 393                titlefig = whichtitle + ', ' + 'day to day difference' + title_option
 394            elif 'weekly' in input_field_tostring:
 395                titlefig = whichtitle + ', ' + 'week to week difference' + title_option
 396            else:
 397                if 'cur_' in  which or 'idx_' in  which:
 398                    #titlefig = which + ', ' + 'current ' + which.replace('cur_','').replace('idx_','')+ title_option
 399                    titlefig = whichtitle + ', current value' + title_option
 400                else:
 401                    titlefig = whichtitle + ', cumulative'+ title_option
 402
 403            if title:
 404                title = title
 405            else:
 406                title  = titlefig
 407            self.uptitle = title
 408
 409            textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', None)
 410            if textcopyright:
 411                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr ' + textcopyright + title_temporal
 412                kwargs.pop('textcopyright')
 413            else:
 414                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr data from: {}'.format(self.database_name)+' '+title_temporal
 415
 416            self.subtitle = textcopyright
 417            kwargs['title'] = title+title_temporal
 418            return func(self, input, input_field, **kwargs)
 419        return wrapper
 420
 421    @decowrapper
 422    def pycoa_resume_data(self, input, input_field, **kwargs):
 423        loc=list(input['clustername'].unique())
 424        input['cases'] = input[input_field]
 425        resumetype = kwargs.get('resumetype','spiral')
 426        if resumetype == 'spiral':
 427            dspiral={i:CocoDisplay.spiral(input.loc[ (input.clustername==i) &
 428                        (input.date >= self.when_beg) &
 429                        (input.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')) for i in loc}
 430            input['resume']=input['clustername'].map(dspiral)
 431        elif resumetype == 'spark':
 432            spark={i:CocoDisplay.sparkline(input.loc[ (input.clustername==i) &
 433                        (input.date >= self.when_beg) &
 434                        (input.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')) for i in loc}
 435            input['resume']=input['clustername'].map(spark)
 436        else:
 437            raise CoaError('pycoa_resume_data can use spiral or spark ... here what ?')
 438        input = input.loc[input.date==input.date.max()].reset_index(drop=True)
 439        def path_to_image_html(path):
 440            return '<img src="'+ path + '" width="60" >'
 441
 442        input=input.drop(columns=['permanentdisplay','rolloverdisplay','colors','cases'])
 443        input=input.apply(lambda x: x.round(2) if x.name in [input_field,'daily','weekly'] else x)
 444        if isinstance(input['where'][0], list):
 445            col=[i for i in list(input.columns) if i not in ['clustername','where','codelocation']]
 446            col.insert(0,'clustername')
 447            input = input[col]
 448            input=input.set_index('clustername')
 449        else:
 450           input = input.drop(columns='clustername')
 451           input=input.set_index('where')
 452
 453        return input.to_html(escape=False,formatters=dict(resume=path_to_image_html))
 454
 455    ''' DECORATORS FOR PLOT: DATE, VERSUS, SCROLLINGMENU '''
 456    def decoplot(func):
 457        """
 458        decorator for plot purpose
 459        """
 460        @wraps(func)
 461        def inner_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 462            mode = kwargs.get('mode', None)
 463            if mode:
 464                mode = mode
 465            else:
 466                mode = self.dvisu_default['mode']
 467            if mode not in self.available_modes:
 468                raise CoaTypeError('Don\'t know the mode wanted. So far:' + str(self.available_modes))
 469            kwargs['mode'] = mode
 470
 471            if 'where' in input.columns:
 472                location_ordered_byvalues = list(
 473                    input.loc[input.date == self.when_end].sort_values(by=input_field, ascending=False)['clustername'].unique())
 474                input = input.copy()  # needed to avoid warning
 475                #input[inputtmp['clustername']] = pd.Categorical(input.clustername,
 476                #                                        categories=location_ordered_byvalues, ordered=True)
 477                input.loc[:,'clustername'] = pd.Categorical(input.clustername,
 478                                                       categories=location_ordered_byvalues, ordered=True)
 479
 480                input = input.sort_values(by=['clustername', 'date']).reset_index(drop = True)
 481
 482                if func.__name__ != 'pycoa_scrollingmenu' :
 483                    if len(location_ordered_byvalues) >= MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED:
 484                        input = input.loc[input.clustername.isin(location_ordered_byvalues[:MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED])]
 485                list_max = []
 486                for i in input_field:
 487                    list_max.append(max(input.loc[input.clustername.isin(location_ordered_byvalues)][i]))
 488                if len([x for x in list_max if not np.isnan(x)]) > 0:
 489                    amplitude = (np.nanmax(list_max) - np.nanmin(list_max))
 490                    if amplitude > 10 ** 4:
 491                        self.ax_type.reverse()
 492                if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_scrollingmenu' :
 493                    if isinstance(input_field,list):
 494                        if len(input_field) > 1:
 495                            print(str(input_field) + ' is dim = ' + str(len(input_field)) + '. No effect with ' + func.__name__ + '! Take the first input: ' + input_field[0])
 496                        input_field = input_field[0]
 497                    if self.dbld[self.database_name][1] == 'nation' and self.dbld[self.database_name][0] != 'WW':
 498                        func.__name__ = 'pycoa_date_plot'
 499            return func(self, input, input_field, **kwargs)
 500        return inner_plot
 501
 502    ''' PLOT VERSUS '''
 503    @decowrapper
 504    @decoplot
 505    def pycoa_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None ,**kwargs):
 506        '''
 507        -----------------
 508        Create a versus plot according to arguments.
 509        See help(pycoa_plot).
 510        Keyword arguments
 511        -----------------
 512        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
 513        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
 514        - input_field = if None take second element. It should be a list dim=2. Moreover the 2 variables must be present
 515        in the DataFrame considered.
 516        - plot_heigh = width_height_default[1]
 517        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
 518        - title = None
 519        - textcopyright = default
 520        - mode = mouse
 521        - cursor_date = None if True
 522                - orientation = horizontal
 523        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
 524                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
 525                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
 526                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
 527                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
 528        '''
 529        if len(input_field) != 2:
 530            raise CoaTypeError('Two variables are needed to plot a versus chart ... ')
 531        panels = []
 532        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
 533        if self.get_listfigures():
 534            self.set_listfigures([])
 535        listfigs=[]
 536        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
 537            standardfig = self.standardfig( x_axis_label = input_field[0], y_axis_label = input_field[1],
 538                                                y_axis_type = axis_type, **kwargs )
 539
 540            standardfig.add_tools(HoverTool(
 541                tooltips=[('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'),
 542                          (input_field[0], '@{casesx}' + '{custom}'),
 543                          (input_field[1], '@{casesy}' + '{custom}')],
 544                formatters={'where': 'printf', '@{casesx}': cases_custom, '@{casesy}': cases_custom,
 545                            '@date': 'datetime'}, mode = kwargs['mode'],
 546                point_policy="snap_to_data"))  # ,PanTool())
 547
 548            for loc in input.clustername.unique():
 549                pandaloc = input.loc[input.clustername == loc].sort_values(by='date', ascending=True)
 550                pandaloc.rename(columns={input_field[0]: 'casesx', input_field[1]: 'casesy'}, inplace=True)
 551                standardfig.line(x='casesx', y='casesy',
 552                                 source=ColumnDataSource(pandaloc), legend_label=pandaloc.clustername.iloc[0],
 553                                 color=pandaloc.colors.iloc[0], line_width=3, hover_line_width=4)
 554
 555            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = "12px"
 556            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title=axis_type)
 557            panels.append(panel)
 558            standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
 559
 560            standardfig.legend.location = "top_left"
 561            listfigs.append(standardfig)
 562            CocoDisplay.bokeh_legend(standardfig)
 563        self.set_listfigures(listfigs)
 564        tabs = Tabs(tabs=panels)
 565        return tabs
 566
 567    ''' DATE PLOT '''
 568    @decowrapper
 569    @decoplot
 570    def pycoa_date_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 571        '''
 572        -----------------
 573        Create a date plot according to arguments. See help(pycoa_date_plot).
 574        Keyword arguments
 575        -----------------
 576        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
 577        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
 578        - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
 579        - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
 580        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
 581        - title = None
 582        - textcopyright = default
 583        - mode = mouse
 584        - guideline = False
 585        - cursor_date = None if True
 586                - orientation = horizontal
 587        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
 588                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
 589                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
 590                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
 591                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
 592        '''
 593        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
 594        panels = []
 595        listfigs = []
 596        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
 597        if 'which' in kwargs and isinstance(kwargs['which'],list):
 598            input_field=kwargs['which']
 599        if isinstance(input['rolloverdisplay'].iloc[0],list):
 600            input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
 601        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
 602            standardfig = self.standardfig( y_axis_type = axis_type, x_axis_type = 'datetime',**kwargs)
 603            i = 0
 604            r_list=[]
 605            maxou=-1000
 606            lcolors = iter(self.lcolors)
 607            line_style = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dotdash','dashdot']
 608            maxou,minou=0,0
 609            tooltips=[]
 610            for val in input_field:
 611                for loc in list(input.clustername.unique()):
 612                    input_filter = input.loc[input.clustername == loc].reset_index(drop = True)
 613                    src = ColumnDataSource(input_filter)
 614                    leg = input_filter.clustername[0]
 615                    #leg = input_filter.permanentdisplay[0]
 616                    if len(input_field)>1:
 617                        leg = input_filter.permanentdisplay[0] + ', ' + val
 618                    if len(list(input.clustername.unique())) == 1:
 619                        color = next(lcolors)
 620                    else:
 621                        color = input_filter.colors[0]
 622                    r = standardfig.line(x = 'date', y = val, source = src,
 623                                     color = color, line_width = 3,
 624                                     legend_label = leg,
 625                                     hover_line_width = 4, name = val, line_dash=line_style[i%4])
 626                    r_list.append(r)
 627                    maxou=max(maxou,np.nanmax(input_filter[val].values))
 628                    minou=max(minou,np.nanmin(input_filter[val].values))
 629
 630                    if minou <0.01:
 631                        tooltips.append([('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), (r.name, '@$name')])
 632                    else:
 633                        tooltips.append([('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), (r.name, '@$name{0,0.0}')])
 634                    if isinstance(tooltips,tuple):
 635                        tooltips = tooltips[0]
 636                i += 1
 637            for i,r in enumerate(r_list):
 638                label = r.name
 639                tt = tooltips[i]
 640                formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@date': 'datetime', '@name': 'printf'}
 641                hover=HoverTool(tooltips = tt, formatters = formatters, point_policy = "snap_to_data", mode = kwargs['mode'], renderers=[r])  # ,PanTool())
 642                standardfig.add_tools(hover)
 643                if guideline:
 644                    cross= CrosshairTool()
 645                    standardfig.add_tools(cross)
 646
 647            if axis_type == 'linear':
 648                if maxou  < 1e4 :
 649                    standardfig.yaxis.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=False)
 650
 651            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = "12px"
 652            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title = axis_type)
 653            panels.append(panel)
 654            standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
 655
 656            standardfig.legend.location  = "top_left"
 657            standardfig.legend.click_policy="hide"
 658            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = '8pt'
 659            if len(input_field) > 1 and len(input_field)*len(input.clustername.unique())>16:
 660                standardfig.legend.visible=False
 661            standardfig.xaxis.formatter = DatetimeTickFormatter(
 662                days = ["%d/%m/%y"], months = ["%d/%m/%y"], years = ["%b %Y"])
 663            CocoDisplay.bokeh_legend(standardfig)
 664            listfigs.append(standardfig)
 665        self.set_listfigures(listfigs)
 666        tabs = Tabs(tabs = panels)
 667        return tabs
 668
 669    ''' SPIRAL PLOT '''
 670    @decowrapper
 671    @decoplot
 672    def pycoa_spiral_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 673        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
 674        panels = []
 675        listfigs = []
 676        if isinstance(input['rolloverdisplay'].iloc[0],list):
 677            input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
 678        borne = 300
 679        kwargs.pop('plot_width')
 680        standardfig = self.standardfig(y_axis_type = None, x_axis_type = None,
 681        width=kwargs['plot_height'], x_range=[-borne, borne], y_range=[-borne, borne], match_aspect=True,**kwargs)
 682
 683        if len(input.clustername.unique()) > 1 :
 684            print('Can only display spiral for ONE location. I took the first one:', input.clustername[0])
 685            input = input.loc[input.clustername == input.clustername[0]].copy()
 686        input['date']=pd.to_datetime(input["date"])
 687        input["dayofyear"]=input.date.dt.dayofyear
 688        input['year']=input.date.dt.year
 689        input['cases'] = input[input_field]
 690
 691        K = 2*input[input_field].max()
 692        #drop bissextile fine tuning in needed in the future
 693        input = input.loc[~(input['date'].dt.month.eq(2) & input['date'].dt.day.eq(29))].reset_index(drop=True)
 694        input["dayofyear_angle"] = input["dayofyear"]*2 * np.pi/365
 695        input["r_baseline"] = input.apply(lambda x : ((x["year"]-2020)*2 * np.pi + x["dayofyear_angle"])*K,axis=1)
 696        size_factor = 16
 697        input["r_cas_sup"] = input.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] + 0.5*x[input_field]*size_factor,axis=1)
 698        input["r_cas_inf"] = input.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] - 0.5*x[input_field]*size_factor,axis=1)
 699
 700        radius = 200
 701        def polar(theta,r,norm=radius/input["r_baseline"].max()):
 702            x = norm*r*np.cos(theta)
 703            y = norm*r*np.sin(theta)
 704            return x,y
 705        x_base,y_base=polar(input["dayofyear_angle"],input["r_baseline"])
 706        x_cas_sup,y_cas_sup=polar(input["dayofyear_angle"],input["r_cas_sup"])
 707        x_cas_inf,y_cas_inf=polar(input["dayofyear_angle"],input["r_cas_inf"])
 708
 709        xcol,ycol=[],[]
 710        [ xcol.append([i,j]) for i,j in zip(x_cas_inf,x_cas_sup)]
 711        [ ycol.append([i,j]) for i,j in zip(y_cas_inf,y_cas_sup)]
 712        standardfig.patches(xcol,ycol,color='blue',fill_alpha = 0.5)
 713
 714        src = ColumnDataSource(data=dict(
 715        x=x_base,
 716        y=y_base,
 717        date=input['date'],
 718        cases=input['cases']
 719        ))
 720        standardfig.line( x = 'x', y = 'y', source = src, legend_label = input.clustername[0],
 721                        line_width = 3, line_color = 'blue')
 722        circle = standardfig.circle('x', 'y', size=2, source=src)
 723
 724        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
 725        hover_tool = HoverTool(tooltips=[('Cases', '@cases{0,0.0}'), ('date', '@date{%F}')],
 726                               formatters={'Cases': 'printf', '@{cases}': cases_custom, '@date': 'datetime'},
 727                               renderers=[circle],
 728                               point_policy="snap_to_data")
 729        standardfig.add_tools(hover_tool)
 730
 731        outer_radius=250
 732        [standardfig.annular_wedge(
 733            x=0, y=0, inner_radius=0, outer_radius=outer_radius, start_angle=i*np.pi/6,\
 734            end_angle=(i+1)*np.pi/6,fill_color=None,line_color='black',line_dash='dotted')
 735        for i in range(12)]
 736
 737        label = ['January','February','March','April','May','June','July','August','September','October','November','December']
 738        xr,yr = polar(np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, 13),outer_radius,1)
 739        standardfig.text(xr[:-1], yr[:-1], label,text_font_size="9pt", text_align="center", text_baseline="middle")
 740
 741        standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
 742        standardfig.legend.location = "top_left"
 743        standardfig.legend.click_policy="hide"
 744        return standardfig
 745
 746    ''' SCROLLINGMENU PLOT '''
 747    @decowrapper
 748    @decoplot
 749    def pycoa_scrollingmenu(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 750        '''
 751        -----------------
 752        Create a date plot, with a scrolling menu location, according to arguments.
 753        See help(pycoa_scrollingmenu).
 754        Keyword arguments
 755        -----------------
 756        len(location) > 2
 757        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
 758        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
 759        - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
 760        - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
 761        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
 762        - title = None
 763        - textcopyright = default
 764        - mode = mouse
 765        -guideline = False
 766        - cursor_date = None if True
 767                - orientation = horizontal
 768        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
 769                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
 770                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
 771                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
 772                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
 773        '''
 774        mode = kwargs.get('mode',self.dvisu_default['mode'])
 775        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
 776
 777        uniqloc = input.clustername.unique().to_list()
 778        uniqloc.sort()
 779        if 'where' in input.columns:
 780            if len(uniqloc) < 2:
 781                raise CoaTypeError('What do you want me to do ? You have selected, only one country.'
 782                                   'There is no sens to use this method. See help.')
 783        input = input[['date', 'clustername', input_field]]
 784        input = input.sort_values(by='clustername', ascending = True).reset_index(drop=True)
 785
 786        mypivot = pd.pivot_table(input, index='date', columns='clustername', values=input_field)
 787        column_order = uniqloc
 788        mypivot = mypivot.reindex(column_order, axis=1)
 789        source = ColumnDataSource(mypivot)
 790
 791        filter_data1 = mypivot[[uniqloc[0]]].rename(columns={uniqloc[0]: 'cases'})
 792        src1 = ColumnDataSource(filter_data1)
 793
 794        filter_data2 = mypivot[[uniqloc[1]]].rename(columns={uniqloc[1]: 'cases'})
 795        src2 = ColumnDataSource(filter_data2)
 796
 797        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
 798        hover_tool = HoverTool(tooltips=[('Cases', '@cases{0,0.0}'), ('date', '@date{%F}')],
 799                               formatters={'Cases': 'printf', '@{cases}': cases_custom, '@date': 'datetime'}, mode = mode,
 800                               point_policy="snap_to_data")  # ,PanTool())
 801
 802        panels = []
 803        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
 804            standardfig = self.standardfig( y_axis_type = axis_type, x_axis_type = 'datetime', **kwargs)
 805
 806            standardfig.yaxis[0].formatter = PrintfTickFormatter(format = "%4.2e")
 807
 808            standardfig.add_tools(hover_tool)
 809            if guideline:
 810                cross= CrosshairTool()
 811                standardfig.add_tools(cross)
 812            def add_line(src, options, init, color):
 813                s = Select(options = options, value = init)
 814                r = standardfig.line(x = 'date', y = 'cases', source = src, line_width = 3, line_color = color)
 815                li = LegendItem(label = init, renderers = [r])
 816                s.js_on_change('value', CustomJS(args=dict(s0=source, s1=src, li=li),
 817                                                 code="""
 818                                            var c = cb_obj.value;
 819                                            var y = s0.data[c];
 820                                            s1.data['cases'] = y;
 821                                            li.label = {value: cb_obj.value};
 822                                            s1.change.emit();
 823                                     """))
 824                return s, li
 825
 826            s1, li1 = add_line(src1, uniqloc, uniqloc[0], self.scolors[0])
 827            s2, li2 = add_line(src2, uniqloc, uniqloc[1], self.scolors[1])
 828            standardfig.add_layout(Legend(items = [li1, li2]))
 829            standardfig.legend.location = 'top_left'
 830            layout = row(column(row(s1, s2), row(standardfig)))
 831            panel = Panel(child = layout, title = axis_type)
 832            panels.append(panel)
 833
 834        tabs = Tabs(tabs = panels)
 835        label = standardfig.title
 836        return tabs
 837
 838    ''' YEARLY PLOT '''
 839    @decowrapper
 840    @decoplot
 841    def pycoa_yearly_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 842        '''
 843        -----------------
 844        Create a date plot according to arguments. See help(pycoa_date_plot).
 845        Keyword arguments
 846        -----------------
 847        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
 848        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
 849        - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
 850        - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
 851        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
 852        - title = None
 853        - textcopyright = default
 854        - mode = mouse
 855        - guideline = False
 856        - cursor_date = None if True
 857                - orientation = horizontal
 858        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
 859                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
 860                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
 861                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
 862                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
 863        '''
 864        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
 865        if len(input.clustername.unique()) > 1 :
 866            print('Can only display yearly plot for ONE location. I took the first one:', input.clustername[0])
 867        input = input.loc[input.clustername == input.clustername[0]].copy()
 868
 869        panels = []
 870        listfigs = []
 871        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
 872        input['date']=pd.to_datetime(input["date"])
 873        #drop bissextile fine tuning in needed in the future
 874        input = input.loc[~(input['date'].dt.month.eq(2) & input['date'].dt.day.eq(29))].reset_index(drop=True)
 875        input = input.copy()
 876        input.loc[:,'allyears']=input['date'].apply(lambda x : x.year)
 877        input['allyears'] = input['allyears'].astype(int)
 878        input.loc[:,'dayofyear']= input['date'].apply(lambda x : x.dayofyear)
 879        allyears = list(input.allyears.unique())
 880        if isinstance(input['rolloverdisplay'].iloc[0],list):
 881            input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
 882        if len(input_field)>1:
 883            CoaError('Only one variable could be displayed')
 884        else:
 885            input_field=input_field[0]
 886        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
 887            standardfig = self.standardfig( y_axis_type = axis_type,**kwargs)
 888            i = 0
 889            r_list=[]
 890            maxou=-1000
 891            input['cases']=input[input_field]
 892            line_style = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dotdash']
 893            colors = itertools.cycle(self.lcolors)
 894            for loc in list(input.clustername.unique()):
 895                for year in allyears:
 896                    input_filter = input.loc[(input.clustername == loc) & (input['date'].dt.year.eq(year))].reset_index(drop = True)
 897                    src = ColumnDataSource(input_filter)
 898                    leg = loc + ' ' + str(year)
 899                    r = standardfig.line(x = 'dayofyear', y = input_field, source = src,
 900                                     color = next(colors), line_width = 3,
 901                                     legend_label = leg,
 902                                     hover_line_width = 4, name = input_field)
 903                    maxou=max(maxou,np.nanmax(input_filter[input_field].values))
 904
 905            label = input_field
 906            tooltips = [('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), ('Cases', '@cases{0,0.0}')]
 907            formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@date': 'datetime', '@name': 'printf'}
 908            hover=HoverTool(tooltips = tooltips, formatters = formatters, point_policy = "snap_to_data", mode = kwargs['mode'])  # ,PanTool())
 909            standardfig.add_tools(hover)
 910            if guideline:
 911                cross= CrosshairTool()
 912                standardfig.add_tools(cross)
 913
 914            if axis_type == 'linear':
 915                if maxou  < 1e4 :
 916                    standardfig.yaxis.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=False)
 917
 918            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = "12px"
 919            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title = axis_type)
 920            panels.append(panel)
 921            standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
 922
 923            standardfig.legend.location = "top_left"
 924            standardfig.legend.click_policy="hide"
 925
 926            labelspd=input.loc[(input.allyears.eq(2021)) & (input.date.dt.day.eq(1))]
 927            standardfig.xaxis.ticker = list(labelspd['dayofyear'].astype(int))
 928            replacelabelspd =  labelspd['date'].apply(lambda x: str(x.strftime("%b")))
 929            #label_dict = dict(zip(input.loc[input.allyears.eq(2020)]['daymonth'],input.loc[input.allyears.eq(2020)]['date'].apply(lambda x: str(x.day)+'/'+str(x.month))))
 930            standardfig.xaxis.major_label_overrides = dict(zip(list(labelspd['dayofyear'].astype(int)),list(replacelabelspd)))
 931
 932            CocoDisplay.bokeh_legend(standardfig)
 933            listfigs.append(standardfig)
 934
 935        tooltips = [('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), (r.name, '@$name{0,0.0}')]
 936        formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@date': 'datetime', '@name': 'printf'}
 937        hover=HoverTool(tooltips = tooltips, formatters = formatters, point_policy = "snap_to_data", mode = kwargs['mode'], renderers=[r])  # ,PanTool())
 938        standardfig.add_tools(hover)
 939        if guideline:
 940            cross= CrosshairTool()
 941            standardfig.add_tools(cross)
 942        self.set_listfigures(listfigs)
 943        tabs = Tabs(tabs = panels)
 944        return tabs
 945
 946    ''' DECORATORS FOR HISTO VERTICAL, HISTO HORIZONTAL, PIE & MAP'''
 947    def decohistomap(func):
 948        """
 949        Decorator function used for histogram and map
 950        """
 951        @wraps(func)
 952        def inner_hm(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 953
 954            tile = kwargs.get('tile', self.dvisu_default['tile'])
 955
 956            maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel', None)
 957            if maplabel :
 958                if not isinstance(maplabel,list):
 959                    maplabel=[maplabel]
 960            #if maplabel:
 961            #    maplabel = maplabel
 962
 963            if 'map' in func.__name__:
 964                kwargs['maplabel'] = maplabel
 965
 966            orientation = kwargs.get('orientation', self.dvisu_default['orientation'])
 967            cursor_date = kwargs.get('cursor_date', None)
 968            #if orientation:
 969            #    kwargs['orientation'] = orientation
 970            #kwargs['cursor_date'] = kwargs.get('cursor_date',  self.dvisu_default['cursor_date'])
 971            if isinstance(input['where'].iloc[0],list):
 972                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
 973                input = input.explode('where')
 974            else:
 975                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
 976
 977            uniqloc = input.clustername.unique()
 978
 979            geopdwd = input
 980            if type(geopdwd) != gpd.geodataframe.GeoDataFrame:
 981                if maplabel and 'unsorted' in maplabel:
 982                    pass
 983                else:
 984                    geopdwd = geopdwd.sort_values(by=input_field, ascending = False).reset_index(drop=True)
 985
 986                started = geopdwd.date.min()
 987                ended = geopdwd.date.max()
 988                if cursor_date:
 989                    date_slider = DateSlider(title = "Date: ", start = started, end = ended,
 990                                         value = started, step=24 * 60 * 60 * 1000, orientation = orientation)
 991                    #wanted_date = date_slider.value_as_datetime.date()
 992
 993                #if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_mapfolium' or func.__name__ == 'pycoa_map' or func.__name__ == 'innerdecomap' or func.__name__ == 'innerdecopycoageo':
 994                if func.__name__ in ['pycoa_mapfolium','pycoa_map','pycoageo' ,'pycoa_pimpmap']:
 995                    if isinstance(input['where'].iloc[0],list):
 996                        geom = self.location_geometry
 997                        geodic={}
 998                        for uclust in geopdwd['clustername'].unique():
 999                            loc = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.clustername==uclust]['where'].iloc[0]
1000                            cumulgeo = list(geom.loc[geom['where'].isin(loc)]['geometry'])
1001                            geodic[uclust]=cumulgeo
1002                        #geodic={loc:geom.loc[geom['where']==loc]['geometry'].values[0] for loc in geopdwd['where'].unique()}
1003                        geopdwd.loc[:,'geometry'] = geopdwd.clustername.map(geodic)
1004                    else:
1005                        geopdwd = pd.merge(geopdwd, self.location_geometry, on='where')
1006                    kwargs['tile'] = tile
1007                    if self.iso3country in ['FRA','USA']:
1008                        geo = copy.deepcopy(self.geo)
1009                        d = geo._list_translation
1010                        if func.__name__ != 'pycoa_mapfolium':
1011                            if any(i in list(geopdwd.codelocation.unique()) for i in d.keys()) \
1012                            or any(True for i in d.keys() if ''.join(list(geopdwd.codelocation.unique())).find(i)!=-1):
1013                                if maplabel:
1014                                    if 'dense' in maplabel:
1015                                        geo.set_dense_geometry()
1016                                        kwargs.pop('tile')
1017                                    elif 'exploded' in maplabel:
1018                                        geo.set_exploded_geometry()
1019                                        kwargs.pop('tile')
1020                                    else:
1021                                        print('don\'t know ')
1022                                else:
1023                                    if any([len(i)==3 for i in geopdwd.codelocation.unique()]):
1024                                        geo.set_dense_geometry()
1025                                        kwargs.pop('tile')
1026                            else:
1027                                geo.set_main_geometry()
1028                                d = {}
1029                            new_geo = geo.get_data()[['name_'+self.granularity,'geometry']]
1030                            new_geo = new_geo.rename(columns={'name_'+self.granularity:'where'})
1031                            new_geo = new_geo.set_index('where')['geometry'].to_dict()
1032                            geopdwd['geometry'] = geopdwd['where'].map(new_geo)
1033                    geopdwd = gpd.GeoDataFrame(geopdwd, geometry=geopdwd.geometry, crs="EPSG:4326")
1034
1035            if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_histo':
1036                pos = {}
1037                new = pd.DataFrame()
1038                n = 0
1039                for i in uniqloc:
1040                    perloc = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.clustername == i]
1041                    if all(perloc != 0):
1042                        pos = perloc.index[0]
1043                        if new.empty:
1044                            new = perloc
1045                        else:
1046                            new = pd.concat([new,perloc])
1047                        n += 1
1048                geopdwd = new.reset_index(drop=True)
1049            if cursor_date:
1050                date_slider = date_slider
1051            else:
1052                date_slider = None
1053            kwargs['date_slider'] = date_slider
1054            return func(self, geopdwd, input_field, **kwargs)
1055        return inner_hm
1056
1057    ''' VERTICAL HISTO '''
1058    @decowrapper
1059    @decohistomap
1060    def pycoa_histo(self,  geopdwd, input_field = None, **kwargs):
1061        '''
1062            -----------------
1063            Create 1D histogramme by value according to arguments.
1064            See help(pycoa_histo).
1065            Keyword arguments
1066            -----------------
1067            - geopdwd : A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
1068            |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
1069            - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
1070            - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
1071            - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
1072            - title = None
1073            - textcopyright = default
1074            - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
1075                     Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
1076                     when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
1077                     if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
1078                     if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
1079        '''
1080        geopdwd_filter = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.date == self.when_end]
1081        geopdwd_filter = geopdwd_filter.reset_index(drop = True)
1082
1083        input = geopdwd_filter.rename(columns = {'cases': input_field})
1084        bins = kwargs.get('bins', None)
1085
1086        if 'where' in input.columns:
1087            uniqloc = list(input.clustername.unique())
1088            allval  = input.loc[input.clustername.isin(uniqloc)][['clustername', input_field,'permanentdisplay']]
1089            min_val = allval[input_field].min()
1090            max_val = allval[input_field].max()
1091
1092            if bins:
1093                bins = bins
1094            else:
1095                if len(uniqloc) == 1:
1096                    bins = 2
1097                    min_val = 0.
1098                else:
1099                    bins = 11
1100
1101            delta = (max_val - min_val ) / bins
1102            interval = [ min_val + i*delta for i in range(bins+1)]
1103
1104            contributors = {  i : [] for i in range(bins+1)}
1105            for i in range(len(allval)):
1106                rank = bisect.bisect_left(interval, allval.iloc[i][input_field])
1107                if rank == bins+1:
1108                    rank = bins
1109                contributors[rank].append(allval.iloc[i]['clustername'])
1110
1111            colors = itertools.cycle(self.lcolors)
1112            lcolors = [next(colors) for i in range(bins+1)]
1113            contributors = dict(sorted(contributors.items()))
1114            frame_histo = pd.DataFrame({
1115                              'left': [0]+interval[:-1],
1116                              'right':interval,
1117                              'middle_bin': [format((i+j)/2, ".1f") for i,j in zip([0]+interval[:-1],interval)],
1118                              'top': [len(i) for i in list(contributors.values())],
1119                              'contributors': [', '.join(i) for i in contributors.values()],
1120                              'colors': lcolors})
1121        #tooltips = """
1122        #<div style="width: 400px">
1123        #<b>Middle value:</b> @middle_bin <br>
1124        #<b>Contributors:</b> @contributors{safe} <br>
1125        #</div>
1126        #"""
1127        tooltips = """
1128        <b>Middle value:</b> @middle_bin <br>
1129        <b>Contributors:</b> @contributors{safe} <br>
1130        """
1131        hover_tool = HoverTool(tooltips = tooltips)
1132        panels = []
1133        bottom = 0
1134        x_axis_type, y_axis_type, axis_type_title = 3 * ['linear']
1135        for axis_type in ["linear", "linlog", "loglin", "loglog"]:
1136            if axis_type == 'linlog':
1137                y_axis_type, axis_type_title = 'log', 'logy'
1138            if axis_type == 'loglin':
1139                x_axis_type, y_axis_type, axis_type_title = 'log', 'linear', 'logx'
1140            if axis_type == 'loglog':
1141                x_axis_type, y_axis_type = 'log', 'log'
1142                axis_type_title = 'loglog'
1143
1144            standardfig = self.standardfig(x_axis_type=x_axis_type, y_axis_type=y_axis_type, **kwargs)
1145
1146            standardfig.yaxis[0].formatter = PrintfTickFormatter(format = "%4.2e")
1147            standardfig.xaxis[0].formatter = PrintfTickFormatter(format="%4.2e")
1148            standardfig.add_tools(hover_tool)
1149            standardfig.x_range = Range1d(1.05 * interval[0], 1.05 * interval[-1])
1150            standardfig.y_range = Range1d(0, 1.05 * frame_histo['top'].max())
1151            if x_axis_type == "log":
1152                left = 0.8
1153                if frame_histo['left'][0] <= 0:
1154                    frame_histo.at[0, 'left'] = left
1155                else:
1156                    left  = frame_histo['left'][0]
1157                standardfig.x_range = Range1d(left, 10 * interval[-1])
1158
1159            if y_axis_type == "log":
1160                bottom = 0.0001
1161                standardfig.y_range = Range1d(0.001, 10 * frame_histo['top'].max())
1162
1163            standardfig.quad(source=ColumnDataSource(frame_histo), top='top', bottom=bottom, left='left', \
1164                             right='right', fill_color='colors')
1165            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title=axis_type_title)
1166            panels.append(panel)
1167        tabs = Tabs(tabs=panels)
1168        return tabs
1169
1170    ''' DECORATORS FOR HISTO VERTICAL, HISTO HORIZONTAL, PIE '''
1171    def decohistopie(func):
1172        @wraps(func)
1173        def inner_decohistopie(self, geopdwd, input_field, **kwargs):
1174            """
1175            Decorator for
1176            Horizontal histogram & Pie Chart
1177            """
1178            geopdwd['cases'] = geopdwd[input_field]
1179            maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel',None)
1180            plot_width = kwargs.get('plot_width',self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
1181            plot_height = kwargs.get('plot_height',self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
1182
1183            geopdwd_filter = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.date == self.when_end]
1184            geopdwd_filter = geopdwd_filter.reset_index(drop = True)
1185            geopdwd_filter['cases'] = geopdwd_filter[input_field]
1186            cursor_date = kwargs.get('cursor_date',self.dvisu_default['cursor_date'])
1187            date_slider = kwargs['date_slider']
1188            my_date = geopdwd.date.unique()
1189            dico_utc = {i: DateSlider(value=i).value for i in my_date}
1190            geopdwd['date_utc'] = [dico_utc[i] for i in geopdwd.date]
1191            #geopdwd = geopdwd.drop_duplicates(["date", "codelocation","clustername"])#for sumall avoid duplicate
1192            #geopdwd_filter = geopdwd_filter.drop_duplicates(["date", "codelocation","clustername"])
1193            geopdwd = geopdwd.drop_duplicates(["date","clustername"])#for sumall avoid duplicate
1194            geopdwd_filter = geopdwd_filter.drop_duplicates(["date","clustername"])
1195            locunique = geopdwd_filter.clustername.unique()#geopdwd_filtered['where'].unique()
1196            geopdwd_filter = geopdwd_filter.copy()
1197            nmaxdisplayed = MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED
1198            toggl = None
1199
1200            if len(locunique) >= nmaxdisplayed :#and func.__name__ != 'pycoa_pie' :
1201                if func.__name__ != 'pycoa_pie' :
1202                    geopdwd_filter = geopdwd_filter.loc[geopdwd_filter.clustername.isin(locunique[:nmaxdisplayed])]
1203                else:
1204                    geopdwd_filter_first = geopdwd_filter.loc[geopdwd_filter.clustername.isin(locunique[:nmaxdisplayed-1])]
1205                    geopdwd_filter_other = geopdwd_filter.loc[geopdwd_filter.clustername.isin(locunique[nmaxdisplayed-1:])]
1206                    geopdwd_filter_other = geopdwd_filter_other.groupby('date').sum()
1207                    geopdwd_filter_other['where'] = 'others'
1208                    geopdwd_filter_other['clustername'] = 'others'
1209                    geopdwd_filter_other['codelocation'] = 'others'
1210                    geopdwd_filter_other['permanentdisplay'] = 'others'
1211                    geopdwd_filter_other['rolloverdisplay'] = 'others'
1212                    geopdwd_filter_other['colors'] = '#FFFFFF'
1213
1214                    geopdwd_filter = geopdwd_filter_first
1215                    geopdwd_filter = pd.concat([geopdwd_filter,geopdwd_filter_other])
1216            if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_horizonhisto' :
1217                #geopdwd_filter['bottom'] = geopdwd_filter.index
1218                geopdwd_filter['left'] = geopdwd_filter['cases']
1219                geopdwd_filter['right'] = geopdwd_filter['cases']
1220                geopdwd_filter['left'] = geopdwd_filter['left'].apply(lambda x: 0 if x > 0 else x)
1221                geopdwd_filter['right'] = geopdwd_filter['right'].apply(lambda x: 0 if x < 0 else x)
1222
1223                n = len(geopdwd_filter.index)
1224                d =  plot_height / n
1225                ymax = plot_height
1226
1227                geopdwd_filter['top'] = [ymax*(n-i)/n + d/2   for i in range(n)]
1228                geopdwd_filter['bottom'] = [ymax*(n-i)/n - d/2 for i in range(n)]
1229                geopdwd_filter['horihistotexty'] = geopdwd_filter['bottom'] + d/2
1230                geopdwd_filter['horihistotextx'] = geopdwd_filter['right']
1231                if maplabel and 'label%' in maplabel:
1232                    geopdwd_filter['right'] = geopdwd_filter['right'].apply(lambda x: 100.*x)
1233                    geopdwd_filter['horihistotextx'] = geopdwd_filter['right']
1234                    geopdwd_filter['horihistotext'] = [str(round(i))+'%' for i in geopdwd_filter['right']]
1235                if maplabel and 'textinteger' in maplabel:
1236                    geopdwd_filter['horihistotext'] = geopdwd_filter['right'].astype(float).astype(int).astype(str)
1237                else:
1238                    geopdwd_filter['horihistotext'] = [ '{:.3g}'.format(float(i)) if float(i)>1.e4 or float(i)<0.01 else round(float(i),2) for i in geopdwd_filter['right'] ]
1239                    geopdwd_filter['horihistotext'] = [str(i) for i in geopdwd_filter['horihistotext']]
1240            if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_pie' :
1241                geopdwd_filter = self.add_columns_for_pie_chart(geopdwd_filter,input_field)
1242                geopdwd = self.add_columns_for_pie_chart(geopdwd,input_field)
1243                if maplabel and 'label%' in maplabel:
1244                    geopdwd_filter['textdisplayed2'] = geopdwd_filter['percentage']
1245                    geopdwd['textdisplayed2'] =  geopdwd['percentage']
1246
1247            source = ColumnDataSource(data = geopdwd)
1248            input_filter = geopdwd_filter
1249            srcfiltered = ColumnDataSource(data = input_filter)
1250            max_value = max(input_filter['cases'])
1251            min_value = min(input_filter['cases'])
1252            min_value_gt0 = min(input_filter[input_filter['cases'] >= 0]['cases'])
1253            panels = []
1254            for axis_type in self.ax_type:
1255                plot_width = kwargs['plot_width']
1256                plot_height = kwargs['plot_height']
1257                standardfig = self.standardfig( x_axis_type = axis_type,  x_range = (1.05*min_value, 1.05 * max_value),**kwargs)
1258                if maplabel and 'label%' in maplabel:
1259                    standardfig.x_range = Range1d(0.01, 1.2 * max_value*100)
1260                    standardfig.xaxis.axis_label = 'percentage(%)'
1261                    standardfig.xaxis.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=False)
1262                else:
1263                    standardfig.xaxis[0].formatter = PrintfTickFormatter(format="%4.2e")
1264                    standardfig.x_range = Range1d(max_value/100., 1.2 * max_value)
1265                if not input_filter[input_filter[input_field] < 0.].empty:
1266                    standardfig.x_range = Range1d(1.2 * min_value, 1.2 * max_value)
1267
1268                if axis_type == "log":
1269                    if not input_filter[input_filter[input_field] < 0.].empty:
1270                        print('Some value are negative, can\'t display log scale in this context')
1271                    else:
1272                        if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_horizonhisto' :
1273                            if maplabel and 'label%' in maplabel:
1274                                standardfig.x_range = Range1d(0.01, 50 * max_value*100)
1275                            else:
1276                                standardfig.x_range = Range1d(max_value/100., 50 * max_value)
1277
1278                            srcfiltered.data['left'] = [min(srcfiltered.data['right'])/100.] * len(srcfiltered.data['right'])
1279
1280                if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_pie':
1281                    if not input_filter[input_filter[input_field] < 0.].empty:
1282                        raise CoaKeyError('Some values are negative, can\'t display a Pie chart, try histo by location')
1283                    standardfig.plot_width = plot_height
1284                    standardfig.plot_height = plot_height
1285
1286                if date_slider:
1287                    date_slider.width = int(0.8*plot_width)
1288                    callback = CustomJS(args = dict(source = source,
1289                                                  source_filter = srcfiltered,
1290                                                  date_slider = date_slider,
1291                                                  ylabel = standardfig.yaxis[0],
1292                                                  title = standardfig.title,
1293                                                  x_range = standardfig.x_range,
1294                                                  x_axis_type = axis_type,
1295                                                  figure = standardfig),
1296                            code = """
1297                            var date_slide = date_slider.value;
1298                            var dates = source.data['date_utc'];
1299                            var val = source.data['cases'];
1300                            var loc = source.data['clustername'];
1301                            //var loc = source.data['where'];
1302                            var subregion = source.data['name_subregion'];
1303                            var codeloc = source.data['codelocation'];
1304                            var colors = source.data['colors'];
1305                            var colors = source.data['colors'];
1306
1307                            var newval = [];
1308                            var newloc = [];
1309                            var newcolors = [];
1310                            var newcodeloc = [];
1311                            var newname_subregion = [];
1312                            var labeldic = {};
1313                            for (var i = 0; i < dates.length; i++){
1314                            if (dates[i] == date_slide){
1315                                newval.push(parseFloat(val[i]));
1316                                newloc.push(loc[i]);
1317                                newcodeloc.push(codeloc[i]);
1318                                newcolors.push(colors[i]);
1319                                if(typeof subregion !== 'undefined')
1320                                    newname_subregion.push(subregion[i]);
1321
1322                                }
1323                            }
1324                            var len = source_filter.data['clustername'].length;
1325
1326                            var indices = new Array(len);
1327                            for (var i = 0; i < len; i++) indices[i] = i;
1328
1329                            indices.sort(function (a, b) { return newval[a] > newval[b] ? -1 : newval[a] < newval[b] ? 1 : 0; });
1330                            var orderval = [];
1331                            var orderloc = [];
1332                            var ordercodeloc = [];
1333                            var ordername_subregion = [];
1334                            var ordercolors = [];
1335                            var textdisplayed = [];
1336                            for (var i = 0; i < len; i++)
1337                            {
1338                                orderval.push(newval[indices[i]]);
1339                                orderloc.push(newloc[indices[i]]);
1340                                ordercodeloc.push(newcodeloc[indices[i]]);
1341
1342                                if(typeof subregion !== 'undefined')
1343                                    ordername_subregion.push(newname_subregion[i]);
1344                                ordercolors.push(newcolors[indices[i]]);
1345                                //labeldic[len-indices[i]] = newcodeloc[indices[i]];
1346                                textdisplayed.push(newcodeloc[indices[i]].padStart(40,' '));
1347                            }
1348
1349
1350                            source_filter.data['cases'] = orderval;
1351                            const reducer = (accumulator, currentValue) => accumulator + currentValue;
1352                            var tot = orderval.reduce(reducer);
1353                            var top = [];
1354                            var bottom = [];
1355                            var starts = [];
1356                            var ends = [];
1357                            var middle = [];
1358                            var text_x = [];
1359                            var text_y = [];
1360                            var r = 0.7;
1361                            var bthick = 0.95;
1362                            var cumul = 0.;
1363                            var percentage = [];
1364                            var angle = [];
1365                            var text_size = [];
1366                            var left_quad = [];
1367                            var right_quad = [];
1368
1369                            for(var i = 0; i < orderval.length; i++)
1370                            {
1371                                cumul += ((orderval[i] / tot) * 2 * Math.PI);
1372                                ends.push(cumul);
1373                                if(i==0)
1374                                    starts.push(0);
1375                                else
1376                                    starts.push(ends[i-1]);
1377                                middle.push((ends[i]+starts[i])/2);
1378                                text_x.push(r*Math.cos(middle[i]));
1379                                text_y.push(r*Math.sin(middle[i]));
1380                                percentage.push(String(100.*orderval[i] / tot).slice(0, 4));
1381                                angle.push((orderval[i] / tot) * 2 * Math.PI)
1382                                /*if ((ends[i]-starts[i]) > 0.08*(2 * Math.PI))
1383                                    text_size.push('10pt');
1384                                else
1385                                    text_size.push('6pt');*/
1386
1387                                //top.push((orderval.length-i) + bthick/2);
1388                                //bottom.push((orderval.length-i) - bthick/2);
1389
1390                                if (isNaN(orderval[i])) orderval[i] = 0.;
1391                                if(orderval[i]<=0.)
1392                                {
1393                                    left_quad.push(orderval[i]);
1394                                    right_quad.push(0.);
1395                                }
1396                                else
1397                                {
1398                                    left_quad.push(0);
1399                                    right_quad.push(orderval[i]);
1400                                }
1401                            }
1402
1403                            source_filter.data['clustername'] = orderloc;
1404                            source_filter.data['codelocation'] = ordercodeloc;
1405                            source_filter.data['colors'] = ordercolors;
1406
1407                            if(typeof subregion !== 'undefined')
1408                                source_filter.data['rolloverdisplay'] = ordername_subregion;
1409                            else
1410                                source_filter.data['rolloverdisplay'] = orderloc;
1411
1412                            source_filter.data['ends'] = ends;
1413                            source_filter.data['starts'] = starts;
1414                            source_filter.data['middle'] = middle;
1415                            source_filter.data['text_x'] = text_x;
1416                            source_filter.data['text_y'] = text_y;
1417                            //source_filter.data['text_size'] = text_size;
1418                            source_filter.data['percentage'] = percentage;
1419                            source_filter.data['angle'] = angle;
1420
1421
1422                            source_filter.data['left'] = left_quad;
1423                            source_filter.data['right'] = right_quad;
1424
1425                            var mid =[];
1426                            var ht = [];
1427                            var textdisplayed2 = [];
1428
1429                            var n = right_quad.length;
1430                            var d = figure.plot_height / n;
1431                            var ymax = figure.plot_height;
1432
1433                            for(i=0; i<right_quad.length;i++){
1434                                top.push(parseInt(ymax*(n-i)/n+d/2));
1435                                bottom.push(parseInt(ymax*(n-i)/n-d/2));
1436                                mid.push(parseInt(ymax*(n-i)/n));
1437                                labeldic[parseInt(ymax*(n-i)/n)] = orderloc[i];//ordercodeloc[i];
1438
1439                                ht.push(right_quad[i].toFixed(2).toString());
1440                                var a=new Intl.NumberFormat().format(right_quad[i])
1441                                textdisplayed2.push(a.toString().padStart(26,' '));
1442                                //textdisplayed2.push(right_quad[i].toFixed(2).toString().padStart(40,' '));
1443
1444                            }
1445                            source_filter.data['top'] = top;
1446                            source_filter.data['bottom'] = bottom;
1447
1448                            source_filter.data['horihistotextxy'] =  mid;
1449                            source_filter.data['horihistotextx'] =  right_quad;
1450                            source_filter.data['horihistotext'] =  ht;
1451                            source_filter.data['permanentdisplay'] = orderloc;//ordercodeloc;
1452                            source_filter.data['textdisplayed'] = textdisplayed;
1453                            source_filter.data['textdisplayed2'] = textdisplayed2;
1454                            var maxx = Math.max.apply(Math, right_quad);
1455                            var minx = Math.min.apply(Math, left_quad);
1456
1457                            ylabel.major_label_overrides = labeldic;
1458                            x_range.end =  1.2 * maxx;
1459                            x_range.start =  1.05 * minx;
1460                            if(minx >= 0){
1461                                x_range.start =  0.01;
1462                                source_filter.data['left'] = Array(left_quad.length).fill(0.01);
1463                                }
1464                            var tmp = title.text;
1465                            tmp = tmp.slice(0, -11);
1466                            var dateconverted = new Date(date_slide);
1467                            var dd = String(dateconverted.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
1468                            var mm = String(dateconverted.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0'); //January is 0!
1469                            var yyyy = dateconverted.getFullYear();
1470                            var dmy = dd + '/' + mm + '/' + yyyy;
1471                            //title.text = tmp + dmy+")";
1472
1473                            source_filter.change.emit();
1474                        """)
1475                    date_slider.js_on_change('value', callback)
1476                    # Set up Play/Pause button/toggle JS
1477                    date_list = pd.date_range(geopdwd.date.min(),geopdwd.date.max()-dt.timedelta(days=1),freq='d').to_list()
1478                    indexCDS = ColumnDataSource(dict(date=date_list))
1479                    toggl_js = CustomJS(args=dict(date_slider=date_slider,indexCDS=indexCDS),code="""
1480                    // A little lengthy but it works for me, for this problem, in this version.
1481                        var check_and_iterate = function(date){
1482                            var slider_val = date_slider.value;
1483                            var toggle_val = cb_obj.active;
1484                            if(toggle_val == false) {
