1485                                cb_obj.label = '► Play';
1486                                clearInterval(looop);
1487                                }
1488                            else if(slider_val == date[date.length - 1]) {
1489                                cb_obj.label = '► Play';
1490                                //date_slider.value = date[0];
1491                                cb_obj.active = false;
1492                                clearInterval(looop);
1493                                }
1494                            else if(slider_val !== date[date.length - 1]){
1495                                date_slider.value = date.filter((item) => item > slider_val)[0];
1496                                }
1497                            else {
1498                            clearInterval(looop);
1499                                }
1500                        }
1501                        if(cb_obj.active == false){
1502                            cb_obj.label = '► Play';
1503                            clearInterval(looop);
1504                        }
1505                        else {
1506                            cb_obj.label = '❚❚ Pause';
1507                            var looop = setInterval(check_and_iterate, 10, indexCDS.data['date']);
1508                        };
1509                    """)
1510
1511                    toggl = Toggle(label='► Play',active=False, button_type="success",height=30,width=10)
1512                    toggl.js_on_change('active',toggl_js)
1513
1514                cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
1515
1516                if min(srcfiltered.data['cases'])<0.01:
1517                    tooltips=[('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), (input_field, '@cases'), ]
1518                else:
1519                    tooltips=[('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), (input_field, '@cases{0,0.0}'), ],
1520                if isinstance(tooltips,tuple):
1521                    tooltips = tooltips[0]
1522                if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_pie' :
1523                    standardfig.add_tools(HoverTool(
1524                        tooltips = tooltips,
1525                        formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@{' + 'cases' + '}': cases_custom, '%':'printf'},
1526                        point_policy = "snap_to_data"))  # ,PanTool())
1527                else:
1528                    standardfig.add_tools(HoverTool(
1529                        tooltips = tooltips,
1530                        formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@{' + 'cases' + '}': cases_custom, },
1531                        point_policy = "snap_to_data"))  # ,PanTool())
1532                panel = Panel(child = standardfig, title = axis_type)
1533                panels.append(panel)
1534
1535            return func(self, srcfiltered, panels, date_slider, toggl)
1536        return inner_decohistopie
1537
1538    ''' VERTICAL HISTO '''
1539    @decowrapper
1540    @decohistomap
1541    @decohistopie
1542    def pycoa_horizonhisto(self, srcfiltered, panels, date_slider,toggl):
1543        '''
1544            -----------------
1545            Create 1D histogramme by location according to arguments.
1546            See help(pycoa_histo).
1547            Keyword arguments
1548            -----------------
1549            - srcfiltered : A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
1550            |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
1551            - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
1552            - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
1553            - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
1554            - title = None
1555            - textcopyright = default
1556            - mode = mouse
1557            - cursor_date = None if True
1558                    - orientation = horizontal
1559            - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
1560                         Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
1561                         when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
1562                         if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
1563                         if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
1564        '''
1565        n = len(panels)
1566        new_panels = []
1567        for i in range(n):
1568            fig = panels[i].child
1569            fig.y_range = Range1d(min(srcfiltered.data['bottom']), max(srcfiltered.data['top']))
1570            fig.yaxis[0].formatter = NumeralTickFormatter(format="0.0")
1571            ytick_loc = [int(i) for i in srcfiltered.data['horihistotexty']]
1572            fig.yaxis.ticker  = ytick_loc
1573            label_dict = dict(zip(ytick_loc,srcfiltered.data['permanentdisplay']))
1574            fig.yaxis.major_label_overrides = label_dict
1575
1576            #print(fig.y_range ,fig.yaxis.major_label_overrides)
1577            fig.quad(source = srcfiltered,
1578                top='top', bottom = 'bottom', left = 'left', right = 'right', color = 'colors', line_color = 'black',
1579                line_width = 1, hover_line_width = 2)
1580
1581            labels = LabelSet(
1582                    x = 'horihistotextx',
1583                    y = 'horihistotexty',
1584                    x_offset=5,
1585                    y_offset=-4,
1586                    text = 'horihistotext',
1587                    source = srcfiltered,text_font_size='10px',text_color='black')
1588            fig.add_layout(labels)
1589
1590            panel = Panel(child = fig, title = panels[i].title)
1591            new_panels.append(panel)
1592        tabs = Tabs(tabs = new_panels)
1593        if date_slider:
1594                tabs = column(date_slider,tabs,toggl)
1595        return tabs
1596
1597    ''' PIE '''
1598    def add_columns_for_pie_chart(self,df,column_name):
1599        df = df.copy()
1600        column_sum = df[column_name].sum()
1601        df['percentage'] = df[column_name]/column_sum
1602        percentages = [0]  + df['percentage'].cumsum().tolist()
1603        df['angle'] = (df[column_name]/column_sum)*2 * np.pi
1604        df['starts'] = [p * 2 * np.pi for p in percentages[:-1]]
1605        df['ends'] = [p * 2 * np.pi for p in percentages[1:]]
1606        df['diff'] = (df['ends'] - df['starts'])
1607        df['middle'] = df['starts']+np.abs(df['ends']-df['starts'])/2.
1608        df['cos'] = np.cos(df['middle']) * 0.9
1609        df['sin'] = np.sin(df['middle']) * 0.9
1610
1611        df['text_size'] = '8pt'
1612        df['textdisplayed'] = df['permanentdisplay'].str.pad(36, side = "left")
1613        try:
1614            locale.setlocale(locale.LC_ALL, 'en_US')
1615        except:
1616            try:
1617                locale.setlocale(locale.LC_ALL, 'en_US.utf8')
1618            except:
1619                raise CoaError("Locale setting problem. Please contact support@pycoa.fr")
1620
1621        df['textdisplayed2'] = [ locale.format("%d", i, grouping=True)\
1622                for i in df[column_name]]
1623        #df['textdisplayed2'] = df[column_name].astype(str) #[i.str for i in df[column_name]]
1624        df['textdisplayed2'] = df['textdisplayed2'].str.pad(26, side = "left")
1625        #df['textdisplayed2']  = df[column_name].str.pad(26, side = "left")
1626        df.loc[df['diff'] <= np.pi/20,'textdisplayed']=''
1627        df.loc[df['diff'] <= np.pi/20,'textdisplayed2']=''
1628        df['percentage'] = 100.*df['percentage']
1629        return df
1630
1631    @decowrapper
1632    @decohistomap
1633    @decohistopie
1634    def pycoa_pie(self, srcfiltered, panels, date_slider,toggl):
1635        '''
1636            -----------------
1637            Create a pie chart according to arguments.
1638            See help(pycoa_pie).
1639            Keyword arguments
1640            -----------------
1641            - srcfiltered : A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
1642            |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
1643            - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
1644            - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
1645            - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
1646            - title = None
1647            - textcopyright = default
1648            - mode = mouse
1649            - cursor_date = None if True
1650                    - orientation = horizontal
1651        '''
1652        standardfig = panels[0].child
1653        standardfig.plot_height=400
1654        standardfig.plot_width=400
1655        standardfig.x_range = Range1d(-1.1, 1.1)
1656        standardfig.y_range = Range1d(-1.1, 1.1)
1657        standardfig.axis.visible = False
1658        standardfig.xgrid.grid_line_color = None
1659        standardfig.ygrid.grid_line_color = None
1660
1661        standardfig.wedge(x=0, y=0, radius=1.,line_color='#E8E8E8',
1662        start_angle=cumsum('angle', include_zero=True), end_angle=cumsum('angle'),
1663        fill_color='colors', legend_label='clustername', source=srcfiltered)
1664        standardfig.legend.visible = False
1665
1666        labels = LabelSet(x=0, y=0,text='textdisplayed',angle=cumsum('angle', include_zero=True),
1667        text_font_size="10pt",source=srcfiltered,render_mode='canvas')
1668
1669        labels2 = LabelSet(x=0, y=0, text='textdisplayed2',
1670        angle=cumsum('angle', include_zero=True),text_font_size="8pt",source=srcfiltered)
1671
1672        standardfig.add_layout(labels)
1673        standardfig.add_layout(labels2)
1674        if date_slider:
1675            standardfig = column(date_slider,standardfig)
1676        return standardfig
1677
1678    ''' MAP FOLIUM '''
1679    @decowrapper
1680    @decohistomap
1681    def pycoa_mapfolium(self, geopdwd, input_field, **kwargs):
1682        '''
1683            -----------------
1684            Create a map folium to arguments.
1685            See help(pycoa_histo).
1686            Keyword arguments
1687            -----------------
1688            - srcfiltered : A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
1689            |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
1690            - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
1691            - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
1692            - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
1693            - title = None
1694            - textcopyright = default
1695            - mode = mouse
1696            - cursor_date = None if True
1697                    - orientation = horizontal
1698            - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
1699                         Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
1700                         when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
1701                         if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
1702                         if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
1703        '''
1704        title = kwargs.get('title', None)
1705        tile =  kwargs.get('tile', self.dvisu_default['tile'])
1706        tile = CocoDisplay.convert_tile(tile, 'folium')
1707        maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel',self.dvisu_default['maplabel'])
1708        plot_width = kwargs.get('plot_width',self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
1709        plot_height = kwargs.get('plot_height',self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
1710
1711        geopdwd['cases'] = geopdwd[input_field]
1712        geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.date == self.when_end]
1713        geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.reset_index(drop = True)
1714        geopdwd_filtered['cases'] = geopdwd_filtered[input_field]
1715        my_date = geopdwd.date.unique()
1716        dico_utc = {i: DateSlider(value=i).value for i in my_date}
1717        geopdwd['date_utc'] = [dico_utc[i] for i in geopdwd.date]
1718        #geopdwd = geopdwd.drop_duplicates(["date", "codelocation","clustername"])#for sumall avoid duplicate
1719        #geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.sort_values(by='cases', ascending = False).reset_index()
1720        #locunique = geopdwd_filtered.clustername.unique()#geopdwd_filtered['where'].unique()
1721        if self.database_name == 'risklayer':
1722            geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.loc[geopdwd_filtered.geometry.notna()]
1723
1724        uniqloc = list(geopdwd_filtered.codelocation.unique())
1725        geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.drop(columns=['date', 'colors'])
1726
1727        msg = "(data from: {})".format(self.database_name)
1728
1729        minx, miny, maxx, maxy =  geopdwd_filtered.total_bounds
1730
1731        mapa = folium.Map(tiles=tile, attr='<a href=\"http://pycoa.fr\"> ©pycoa.fr </a>' + msg)
1732        #min_lat=minx, max_lat=maxx, min_lon=miny, max_lon=maxy)
1733        #location=[geopdwd_filtered.centroid.y.mean(),geopdwd_filtered.centroid.x.mean()],)
1734        if self.dbld[self.database_name][0] != 'WW':
1735            mapa.fit_bounds([(miny, minx), (maxy, maxx)])
1736
1737        fig = Figure(width=plot_width, height=plot_height)
1738        fig.add_child(mapa)
1739        min_col, max_col = CocoDisplay.min_max_range(np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered[input_field]),
1740                                                     np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered[input_field]))
1741        min_col_non0 = (np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered.loc[geopdwd_filtered['cases']>0.]['cases']))
1742
1743        invViridis256 = Viridis256[::-1]
1744        if maplabel and 'log' in maplabel:
1745            geopdwd_filtered['cases'] = geopdwd_filtered.loc[geopdwd_filtered['cases']>0]['cases']
1746            color_mapper = LinearColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col_non0, high=max_col, nan_color='#d9d9d9')
1747            colormap =  branca.colormap.LinearColormap(color_mapper.palette).to_step(data=list(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),n=10,method='log')
1748        else:
1749            color_mapper = LinearColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col, high=max_col, nan_color='#d9d9d9')
1750            colormap = branca.colormap.LinearColormap(color_mapper.palette).scale(min_col, max_col)
1751        colormap.caption =  title
1752        colormap.add_to(mapa)
1753        map_id = colormap.get_name()
1754
1755        custom_label_colorbar_js = """
1756        var div = document.getElementById('legend');
1757        var ticks = document.getElementsByClassName('tick')
1758        for(var i = 0; i < ticks.length; i++){
1759        var values = ticks[i].textContent.replace(',','')
1760        val = parseFloat(values).toExponential(1).toString().replace("+", "")
1761        if(parseFloat(ticks[i].textContent) == 0) val = 0.
1762        div.innerHTML = div.innerHTML.replace(ticks[i].textContent,val);
1763        }
1764        """
1765        e = Element(custom_label_colorbar_js)
1766        html = colormap.get_root()
1767        html.script.get_root().render()
1768        html.script._children[e.get_name()] = e
1769        geopdwd_filtered[input_field + 'scientific_format'] = \
1770            (['{:.5g}'.format(i) for i in geopdwd_filtered['cases']])
1771        # (['{:.3g}'.format(i) if i>100000 else i for i in geopdwd_filter[input_field]])
1772
1773        map_dict = geopdwd_filtered.set_index('where')[input_field].to_dict()
1774        if np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered[input_field]) == np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered[input_field]):
1775            map_dict['FakeCountry'] = 0.
1776
1777        if maplabel and 'log' in maplabel:
1778            color_scale =  branca.colormap.LinearColormap(color_mapper.palette).to_step(data=list(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),n=10,method='log')
1779        else:
1780            color_scale = LinearColormap(color_mapper.palette, vmin=min(map_dict.values()), vmax=max(map_dict.values()))
1781
1782        def get_color(feature):
1783            value = map_dict.get(feature['properties']['where'])
1784            if value is None or np.isnan(value):
1785                return '#8c8c8c'  # MISSING -> gray
1786            else:
1787                return color_scale(value)
1788
1789        displayed = 'rolloverdisplay'
1790        folium.GeoJson(
1791            geopdwd_filtered,
1792            style_function=lambda x:
1793            {
1794                'fillColor': get_color(x),
1795                'fillOpacity': 0.8,
1796                'color': None
1797            },
1798            highlight_function=lambda x: {'weight': 2, 'color': 'green'},
1799            tooltip=folium.features.GeoJsonTooltip(fields=[displayed, input_field + 'scientific_format'],
1800                                                   aliases=['where' + ':', input_field + ":"],
1801                                                   style="""
1802                        background-color: #F0EFEF;
1803                        border: 2px solid black;
1804                        border-radius: 3px;
1805                        box-shadow: 3px;
1806                        opacity: 0.2;
1807                        """),
1808            # '<div style="barialckground-color: royalblue 0.2; color: black; padding: 2px; border: 1px solid black; border-radius: 2px;">'+input_field+'</div>'])
1809        ).add_to(mapa)
1810        return mapa
1811
1812    ''' DECORATOR FOR MAP BOKEH '''
1813    def decopycoageo(func):
1814        @wraps(func)
1815        def innerdecopycoageo(self, geopdwd, input_field, **kwargs):
1816            geopdwd['cases'] = geopdwd[input_field]
1817            if self.pycoageopandas:
1818                loc=geopdwd['where'].unique()
1819                locgeo=geopdwd.loc[geopdwd['where'].isin(loc)].drop_duplicates('where').set_index('where')['geometry']
1820                geopdwd=fill_missing_dates(geopdwd)
1821                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.date == self.when_end]
1822                geopdwd_filtered_cp = geopdwd_filtered.copy()
1823                geopdwd_filtered_cp.loc[:,'geometry']=geopdwd_filtered_cp['where'].map(locgeo)
1824                geopdwd_filtered_cp.loc[:,'geometry']=geopdwd_filtered_cp['geometry'].to_crs(crs="EPSG:4326")
1825                geopdwd_filtered_cp.loc[:,'clustername']=geopdwd_filtered_cp['where']
1826                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered_cp
1827            else:
1828                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.date == self.when_end]
1829                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.reset_index(drop = True)
1830                geopdwd_filtered = gpd.GeoDataFrame(geopdwd_filtered, geometry=geopdwd_filtered.geometry, crs="EPSG:4326")
1831                geopdwd = geopdwd.sort_values(by=['clustername', 'date'], ascending = [True, False])
1832                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.sort_values(by=['clustername', 'date'], ascending = [True, False]).drop(columns=['date', 'colors'])
1833                new_poly = []
1834                geolistmodified = dict()
1835
1836                for index, row in geopdwd_filtered.iterrows():
1837                    split_poly = []
1838                    new_poly = []
1839                    if row['geometry']:
1840                        for pt in self.get_polycoords(row):
1841                            if type(pt) == tuple:
1842                                new_poly.append(CocoDisplay.wgs84_to_web_mercator(pt))
1843                            elif type(pt) == list:
1844                                shifted = []
1845                                for p in pt:
1846                                    shifted.append(CocoDisplay.wgs84_to_web_mercator(p))
1847                                new_poly.append(sg.Polygon(shifted))
1848                            else:
1849                                raise CoaTypeError("Neither tuple or list don't know what to do with \
1850                                    your geometry description")
1851
1852                        if type(new_poly[0]) == tuple:
1853                            geolistmodified[row['where']] = sg.Polygon(new_poly)
1854                        else:
1855                            geolistmodified[row['where']] = sg.MultiPolygon(new_poly)
1856                ng = pd.DataFrame(geolistmodified.items(), columns=['where', 'geometry'])
1857                geolistmodified = gpd.GeoDataFrame({'where': ng['where'], 'geometry': gpd.GeoSeries(ng['geometry'])}, crs="epsg:3857")
1858                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.drop(columns='geometry')
1859                geopdwd_filtered = pd.merge(geolistmodified, geopdwd_filtered, on='where')
1860                #if kwargs['wanted_dates']:
1861                #    kwargs.pop('wanted_dates')
1862
1863            return func(self, geopdwd, geopdwd_filtered, **kwargs)
1864        return innerdecopycoageo
1865
1866    ''' RETURN GEOMETRY, LOCATIO + CASES '''
1867    @decowrapper
1868    @decohistomap
1869    @decopycoageo
1870    def pycoageo(self, geopdwd, geopdwd_filtered, **kwargs):
1871        return geopdwd
1872
1873    def decomap(func):
1874        @wraps(func)
1875        def innerdecomap(self, geopdwd, geopdwd_filtered, **kwargs):
1876            title = kwargs.get('title', None)
1877            maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel',self.dvisu_default['maplabel'])
1878            tile =  kwargs.get('tile', None)
1879            if tile:
1880                tile = CocoDisplay.convert_tile(tile, 'bokeh')
1881            uniqloc = list(geopdwd_filtered.clustername.unique())
1882            dfLabel = pd.DataFrame()
1883            sourcemaplabel = ColumnDataSource(dfLabel)
1884            if maplabel or func.__name__ in ['pycoa_pimpmap','pycoa_map','pycoa_mapfolium']:
1885                locsum = geopdwd_filtered.clustername.unique()
1886                numberpercluster = geopdwd_filtered['clustername'].value_counts().to_dict()
1887                sumgeo = geopdwd_filtered.copy()
1888                if self.pycoageopandas == True:
1889                    sumgeo = sumgeo.to_crs(3035)
1890                else:
1891                    sumgeo['geometry'] = sumgeo['geometry'].buffer(0.001) #needed with geopandas 0.10.2
1892
1893                sumgeo.loc[:,'centroidx'] = sumgeo['geometry'].centroid.x
1894                sumgeo.loc[:,'centroidy'] = sumgeo['geometry'].centroid.y
1895                clust=sumgeo.clustername.unique()
1896
1897                centrosx = [sumgeo.loc[sumgeo.clustername==i]['centroidx'].mean() for i in clust]
1898                centrosy = [sumgeo.loc[sumgeo.clustername==i]['centroidy'].mean() for i in clust]
1899                sumgeo = sumgeo.dissolve(by='clustername', aggfunc='sum').reset_index()
1900                sumgeo['nb'] = sumgeo['clustername'].map(numberpercluster)
1901                cases = sumgeo['cases']/sumgeo['nb']
1902
1903                dfLabel=pd.DataFrame({'clustername':sumgeo.clustername,'centroidx':centrosx,'centroidy':centrosy,'cases':cases,'geometry':sumgeo['geometry']})
1904
1905                if maplabel:
1906                    if 'spark' in maplabel:
1907                        sparkos = {i: CocoDisplay.sparkline(geopdwd.loc[ (geopdwd.clustername==i) &
1908                                    (geopdwd.date >= self.when_beg) &
1909                                    (geopdwd.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')['cases']) for i in locsum }
1910                        dfpimp = pd.DataFrame(list(sparkos.items()), columns=['clustername', 'pimpmap'])
1911                        dfLabel=pd.merge(dfLabel,dfpimp,on=['clustername'],how="inner")
1912                    if 'spiral' in maplabel:
1913                        sparkos = {i: CocoDisplay.spiral(geopdwd.loc[ (geopdwd.clustername==i) &
1914                                    (geopdwd.date >= self.when_beg) &
1915                                    (geopdwd.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')[['date','cases','clustername']]) for i in locsum }
1916                        dfpimp = pd.DataFrame(list(sparkos.items()), columns=['clustername', 'pimpmap'])
1917                        dfLabel=pd.merge(dfLabel,dfpimp,on=['clustername'],how="inner")
1918
1919                dfLabel['cases'] = dfLabel['cases'].round(2)
1920                # Converting links to html tags
1921                if maplabel and 'label%' in maplabel:
1922                    dfLabel['cases'] = [str(round(float(i*100),2))+'%' for i in dfLabel['cases']]
1923                else:
1924                    dfLabel['cases']=[str(i) for i in dfLabel['cases']]
1925                sourcemaplabel = ColumnDataSource(dfLabel.drop(columns='geometry'))
1926            minx, miny, maxx, maxy =  geopdwd_filtered.total_bounds #self.boundary
1927
1928            kwargs['plot_width']=kwargs['plot_height']
1929            x_range=(minx,maxx)
1930            y_range=(miny,maxy)
1931            if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_pimpmap':
1932                standardfig = self.standardfig(x_range=x_range, y_range=y_range, x_axis_type="mercator", y_axis_type="mercator",**kwargs,match_aspect=True)
1933            else:
1934                standardfig = self.standardfig(x_axis_type="mercator", y_axis_type="mercator",**kwargs,match_aspect=True)
1935
1936            if tile:
1937                wmt = WMTSTileSource(
1938                            url=tile)
1939                standardfig.add_tile(wmt)
1940            else:
1941                standardfig.background_fill_color = "lightgrey"
1942
1943            geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered[['cases','geometry','where','clustername','codelocation','rolloverdisplay']]
1944            if not dfLabel.empty:
1945                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.drop(columns = 'geometry')
1946                geopdwd_filtered = pd.merge(geopdwd_filtered, dfLabel[['clustername','geometry']], on = 'clustername')
1947                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.drop_duplicates(subset = ['clustername'])
1948            if self.dbld[self.database_name][0] == 'BEL' :
1949                reorder = list(geopdwd_filtered['where'].unique())
1950                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.set_index('where')
1951                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.reindex(index = reorder)
1952                geopdwd_filtered = geopdwd_filtered.reset_index()
1953
1954            if self.dbld[self.database_name][0] == 'GBR' :
1955                geopdwd = geopdwd.loc[~geopdwd.cases.isnull()]
1956                geopdwd_filtered  = geopdwd_filtered.loc[~geopdwd_filtered.cases.isnull()]
1957            return func(self, geopdwd, geopdwd_filtered, sourcemaplabel, standardfig,**kwargs)
1958        return innerdecomap
1959
1960    ''' MAP BOKEH '''
1961    @decowrapper
1962    @decohistomap
1963    @decopycoageo
1964    @decomap
1965    def pycoa_map(self, geopdwd, geopdwd_filtered, sourcemaplabel, standardfig,**kwargs):
1966        '''
1967            -----------------
1968            Create a map bokeh with arguments.
1969            See help(pycoa_histo).
1970            Keyword arguments
1971            -----------------
1972            - srcfiltered : A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
1973            |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
1974            - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
1975            - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
1976            - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
1977            - title = None
1978            - textcopyright = default
1979            - mode = mouse
1980            - cursor_date = None if True
1981                    - orientation = horizontal
1982            - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
1983                         Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
1984                         when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
1985                         if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
1986                         if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
1987            - tile : tile
1988            - maplabel: False
1989        '''
1990        date_slider = kwargs['date_slider']
1991        maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel',self.dvisu_default['maplabel'])
1992        min_col, max_col, min_col_non0 = 3*[0.]
1993        try:
1994            if date_slider:
1995                min_col, max_col = CocoDisplay.min_max_range(np.nanmin(geopdwd['cases']),
1996                                                         np.nanmax(geopdwd['cases']))
1997                min_col_non0 = (np.nanmin(geopdwd.loc[geopdwd['cases']>0.]['cases']))
1998            else:
1999                min_col, max_col = CocoDisplay.min_max_range(np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),
2000                                                         np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered['cases']))
2001                min_col_non0 = (np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered.loc[geopdwd_filtered['cases']>0.]['cases']))
2002        except ValueError:  #raised if `geopdwd_filtered` is empty.
2003            pass
2004        #min_col, max_col = np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered['cases'])
2005
2006        json_data = json.dumps(json.loads(geopdwd_filtered.to_json()))
2007        geopdwd_filtered = GeoJSONDataSource(geojson=json_data)
2008
2009        invViridis256 = Viridis256[::-1]
2010        if maplabel and 'log' in maplabel:
2011            color_mapper = LogColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col_non0, high=max_col, nan_color='#ffffff')
2012        else:
2013            color_mapper = LinearColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col, high=max_col, nan_color='#ffffff')
2014        color_bar = ColorBar(color_mapper=color_mapper, label_standoff=4, bar_line_cap='round',
2015                             border_line_color=None, location=(0, 0), orientation='horizontal', ticker=BasicTicker())
2016        color_bar.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=True, precision=1, power_limit_low=int(max_col))
2017
2018        if maplabel and 'label%' in maplabel:
2019            color_bar.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=False)
2020            color_bar.formatter = NumeralTickFormatter(format="0.0%")
2021
2022        standardfig.add_layout(color_bar, 'below')
2023        standardfig.add_layout(Title(text=self.subtitle, text_font_size="8pt", text_font_style="italic"), 'below')
2024        if date_slider:
2025            allcases_location, allcases_dates = pd.DataFrame(), pd.DataFrame()
2026            allcases_location = geopdwd.groupby('where')['cases'].apply(list)
2027            geopdwd_tmp = geopdwd.drop_duplicates(subset = ['where']).drop(columns = 'cases')
2028            geopdwd_tmp = pd.merge(geopdwd_tmp, allcases_location, on = 'where')
2029            geopdwd_tmp  = geopdwd_tmp.drop_duplicates(subset = ['clustername'])
2030            geopdwd_tmp = ColumnDataSource(geopdwd_tmp.drop(columns=['geometry']))
2031
2032            sourcemaplabel.data['rolloverdisplay'] = sourcemaplabel.data['clustername']
2033
2034            callback = CustomJS(args =  dict(source = geopdwd_tmp, source_filter = geopdwd_filtered,
2035                                          date_sliderjs = date_slider, title=standardfig.title,
2036                                          color_mapperjs = color_mapper, maplabeljs = sourcemaplabel),
2037                        code = """
2038                        var ind_date_max = (date_sliderjs.end-date_sliderjs.start)/(24*3600*1000);
2039                        var ind_date = (date_sliderjs.value-date_sliderjs.start)/(24*3600*1000);
2040                        var new_cases = [];
2041                        var dict = {};
2042                        var iloop = source_filter.data['clustername'].length;
2043
2044                        function form(value) {
2045                             if(value>10000 || value <0.01)
2046                                value =  Number.parseFloat(value).toExponential(2);
2047                             else
2048                                 value = Number.parseFloat(value).toFixed(2);
2049                            return value;
2050                         }
2051                        for (var i = 0; i < source.get_length(); i++)
2052                        {
2053                                var val=form(source.data['cases'][i][ind_date_max-ind_date]);
2054                                new_cases.push(val);
2055                        }
2056                        if(source.get_length() == 1 && iloop>1)
2057                            for(var i = 0; i < iloop; i++)
2058                                for(var j = 0; j < new_cases.length; j++){
2059                                source_filter.data['cases'][i][j] = new_cases[j];
2060                                }
2061                        else{
2062                            source_filter.data['cases'] = new_cases;
2063                            }
2064
2065                        if (maplabeljs.get_length() !== 0){
2066                            maplabeljs.data['cases'] = source_filter.data['cases'];
2067                            }
2068                        for (var i = 0; i < maplabeljs.get_length(); i++)
2069                        {
2070                            maplabeljs.data['cases'][i] = form(maplabeljs.data['cases'][i]).toString();
2071                            maplabeljs.data['rolloverdisplay'][i] = source_filter.data['rolloverdisplay'][i];
2072                        }
2073
2074                        var tmp = title.text;
2075                        tmp = tmp.slice(0, -11);
2076                        var dateconverted = new Date(date_sliderjs.value);
2077                        var dd = String(dateconverted.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
2078                        var mm = String(dateconverted.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0'); //January is 0!
2079                        var yyyy = dateconverted.getFullYear();
2080                        var dmy = dd + '/' + mm + '/' + yyyy;
2081                        title.text = tmp + dmy+")";
2082
2083                        if (maplabeljs.get_length() !== 0)
2084                            maplabeljs.change.emit();
2085
2086                        color_mapperjs.high=Math.max.apply(Math, new_cases);
2087                        color_mapperjs.low=Math.min.apply(Math, new_cases);
2088                        console.log(maplabeljs.data['cases']);
2089                        source_filter.change.emit();
2090                    """)
2091            date_slider.js_on_change('value', callback)
2092            # Set up Play/Pause button/toggle JS
2093            date_list = pd.date_range(geopdwd.date.min(),geopdwd.date.max()-dt.timedelta(days=1),freq='d').to_list()
2094            indexCDS = ColumnDataSource(dict(date=date_list))
2095            toggl_js = CustomJS(args=dict(date_slider=date_slider,indexCDS=indexCDS),code="""
2096            // A little lengthy but it works for me, for this problem, in this version.
2097                var check_and_iterate = function(date){
2098                    var slider_val = date_slider.value;
2099                    var toggle_val = cb_obj.active;
2100                    if(toggle_val == false) {
2101                        cb_obj.label = '► Play';
2102                        clearInterval(looop);
2103                        }
2104                    else if(slider_val == date[date.length - 1]) {
2105                        cb_obj.label = '► Play';
2106                        //date_slider.value = date[0];
2107                        cb_obj.active = false;
2108                        clearInterval(looop);
2109                        }
2110                    else if(slider_val !== date[date.length - 1]){
2111                        date_slider.value = date.filter((item) => item > slider_val)[0];
2112                        }
2113                    else {
2114                    clearInterval(looop);
2115                        }
2116                }
2117                if(cb_obj.active == false){
2118                    cb_obj.label = '► Play';
2119                    clearInterval(looop);
2120                }
2121                else {
2122                    cb_obj.label = '❚❚ Pause';
2123                    var looop = setInterval(check_and_iterate, 10, indexCDS.data['date']);
2124                };
2125            """)
2126
2127            toggl = Toggle(label='► Play',active=False, button_type="success",height=30,width=10)
2128            toggl.js_on_change('active',toggl_js)
2129
2130
2131        standardfig.xaxis.visible = False
2132        standardfig.yaxis.visible = False
2133        standardfig.xgrid.grid_line_color = None
2134        standardfig.ygrid.grid_line_color = None
2135        standardfig.patches('xs', 'ys', source = geopdwd_filtered,
2136                            fill_color = {'field': 'cases', 'transform': color_mapper},
2137                            line_color = 'black', line_width = 0.25, fill_alpha = 1)
2138        if maplabel:
2139            if 'text' in maplabel or 'textinteger' in maplabel:
2140
2141                if 'textinteger' in maplabel:
2142                    sourcemaplabel.data['cases'] = sourcemaplabel.data['cases'].astype(float).astype(int).astype(str)
2143                labels = LabelSet(
2144                    x = 'centroidx',
2145                    y = 'centroidy',
2146                    text = 'cases',
2147                    source = sourcemaplabel, text_font_size='10px',text_color='white',background_fill_color='grey',background_fill_alpha=0.5)
2148                standardfig.add_layout(labels)
2149
2150        #cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
2151        callback = CustomJS(code="""
2152        //document.getElementsByClassName('bk-tooltip')[0].style.backgroundColor="transparent";
2153        document.getElementsByClassName('bk-tooltip')[0].style.opacity="0.7";
2154        """ )
2155        tooltips = """
2156                    <b>location: @rolloverdisplay<br>
2157                    cases: @cases{0,0.0} </b>
2158                    """
2159
2160        standardfig.add_tools(HoverTool(tooltips = tooltips,
2161        formatters = {'where': 'printf', 'cases': 'printf',},
2162        point_policy = "snap_to_data",callback=callback))  # ,PanTool())
2163        if date_slider:
2164            standardfig = column(date_slider, standardfig,toggl)
2165        self.pycoageopandas = False
2166        return standardfig
2167
2168    ''' PIMPMAP BOKEH '''
2169    @decowrapper
2170    @decohistomap
2171    @decopycoageo
2172    @decomap
2173    def pycoa_pimpmap(self, geopdwd, geopdwd_filtered, sourcemaplabel, standardfig,**kwargs):
2174        '''
2175            -----------------
2176            Create a bokeh map with pimpline label and with to arguments.
2177            See help(pycoa_histo).
2178            Keyword arguments
2179            -----------------
2180            - srcfiltered : A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
2181            |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
2182            - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
2183            - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
2184            - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
2185            - title = None
2186            - textcopyright = default
2187            - mode = mouse
2188            - cursor_date = None if True
2189                    - orientation = horizontal
2190            - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
2191                         Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
2192                         when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
2193                         if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
2194                         if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
2195            - tile : tile
2196            - maplabel: False
2197        '''
2198        standardfig.xaxis.visible = False
2199        standardfig.yaxis.visible = False
2200        standardfig.xgrid.grid_line_color = None
2201        standardfig.ygrid.grid_line_color = None
2202
2203        min_col, max_col = CocoDisplay.min_max_range(np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),
2204                                                     np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered['cases']))
2205
2206        json_data = json.dumps(json.loads(geopdwd_filtered.to_json()))
2207        geopdwd_filtered = GeoJSONDataSource(geojson=json_data)
2208
2209        invViridis256 = Viridis256[::-1]
2210        color_mapper = LinearColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col, high=max_col, nan_color='#ffffff')
2211        color_bar = ColorBar(color_mapper=color_mapper, label_standoff=4,
2212                             border_line_color=None, location=(0, 0), orientation='horizontal', ticker=BasicTicker())
2213        color_bar.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=True, precision=1, power_limit_low=int(max_col))
2214        standardfig.add_layout(color_bar, 'below')
2215        standardfig.patches('xs', 'ys', source = geopdwd_filtered,
2216                                    fill_color = {'field': 'cases', 'transform': color_mapper},
2217                                    line_color = 'black', line_width = 0.25, fill_alpha = 1)
2218        standardfig.image_url(url='pimpmap', x='centroidx', y='centroidy',source=sourcemaplabel,anchor="center")
2219        return standardfig
2220    ######################
2221    def tiles_list(self):
2222        return self.available_tiles
2223    ###################### BEGIN Static Methods ##################
2224    @staticmethod
2225    def convert_tile(tilename, which = 'bokeh'):
2226        ''' Return tiles url according to folium or bokeh resquested'''
2227        tile = 'openstreet'
2228        if tilename == 'openstreet':
2229            if which == 'folium':
2230                tile = r'https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png'
2231            else:
2232                tile = r'http://c.tile.openstreetmap.org/{Z}/{X}/{Y}.png'
2233        elif tilename == 'positron':
2234            print('Problem with positron tile (huge http resquest need to check), esri is then used ...')
2235            tile = r'https://server.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/World_Imagery/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}.png'
2236        #    tile = 'https://tiles.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_all/{z}/{x}/{y}.png'
2237        elif tilename == 'esri':
2238            tile = r'https://server.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/World_Imagery/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}.png'
2239        elif tilename == 'stamen':
2240            tile = r'http://tile.stamen.com/toner/{z}/{x}/{y}.png'
2241        else:
2242            print('Don\'t know you tile ... take default one: ')
2243        return tile
2244    #####################
2245    @staticmethod
2246    def dict_shorten_loc(toshort):
2247        '''
2248            return a shorten name location
2249        '''
2250        s = []
2251        if type(toshort) == np.ndarray:
2252            toshort = list(toshort)
2253            toshort = [toshort]
2254            s = ''
2255        elif type(toshort) == str:
2256            toshort = [toshort]
2257            s = ''
2258        #if type(toshort) != list:
2259        #    print('That is weird ...', toshort, 'not str nor list')
2260        for val in toshort:
2261            if not isinstance(val,str):
2262                val= str(val)
2263            if type(val) == list:
2264                val = val[0]
2265            if val.find(',') == -1:
2266                A = val
2267            else:
2268                txt = val.split(',')
2269                if len(txt[0]) < 4 and len(txt[-1]) < 4:
2270                    A = [txt[0] + '...' + txt[-1]]
2271                else:
2272                    A = txt[0][:5] + '...' + txt[-1][-5:]
2273            if type(s) == list:
2274                s.append(A)
2275            else:
2276                s = A
2277            if isinstance(s, list):
2278                s=s[0]
2279        return s
2280    ######################
2281    @staticmethod
2282    def bokeh_legend(bkfigure):
2283        toggle_legend_js = CustomJS(args=dict(leg=bkfigure.legend[0]),
2284                                    code="""
2285        if(leg.visible)
2286        {
2287            leg.visible = false;
2288        }
2289        else
2290        {
2291            leg.visible = true;
2292        }
2293        """)
2294        bkfigure.js_on_event(events.DoubleTap, toggle_legend_js)
2295    ######################
2296    @staticmethod
2297    def min_max_range(a_min, a_max):
2298        """ Return a cleverly rounded min and max giving raw min and raw max of data.
2299        Usefull for hist range and colormap
2300        """
2301        min_p = 0
2302        max_p = 0
2303        if a_min != 0:
2304            min_p = math.floor(math.log10(math.fabs(a_min)))  # power
2305        if a_max != 0:
2306            max_p = math.floor(math.log10(math.fabs(a_max)))
2307
2308        if a_min == 0:
2309            if a_max == 0:
2310                p = 0
2311            else:
2312                p = max_p
2313        else:
2314            if a_max == 0:
2315                p = min_p
2316            else:
2317                p = max(min_p, max_p)
2318
2319        if a_min != 0:
2320            min_r = math.floor(a_min / 10 ** (p - 1)) * 10 ** (p - 1)  # min range rounded
2321        else:
2322            min_r = 0
2323
2324        if a_max != 0:
2325            max_r = math.ceil(a_max / 10 ** (p - 1)) * 10 ** (p - 1)
2326        else:
2327            max_r = 0
2328
2329        if min_r == max_r:
2330            if min_r == 0:
2331                min_r = -1
2332                max_r = 1
2333                k = 0
2334            elif max_r > 0:
2335                k = 0.1
2336            else:
2337                k = -0.1
2338            max_r = (1 + k) * max_r
2339            min_r = (1 - k) * min_r
2340
2341        return (min_r, max_r)
2342    ######################
2343    @staticmethod
2344    def save_map2png(map=None, pngfile='map.png'):
2345        """
2346        Save map as png geckodriver and PIL packages are needed
2347        """
2348        size = width_height_default[0], width_height_default[1]
2349        if pngfile:
2350            pngfile = pngfile
2351        img_data = map._to_png(5)
2352        img = Image.open(io.BytesIO(img_data))
2353        img.thumbnail(size, Image.ANTIALIAS)
2354        img.save(pngfile)
2355        print(pngfile, ' is now save ...')
2356    ######################
2357    @staticmethod
2358    def save_pandas_as_png(df=None, pngfile='pandas.png'):
2359        source = ColumnDataSource(df)
2360        df_columns = [df.index.name]
2361        df_columns.extend(df.columns.values)
2362        columns_for_table = []
2363        for column in df_columns:
2364            if column is not None:
2365                columns_for_table.append(TableColumn(field=column, title=column))
2366                # width_height_default
2367        data_table = DataTable(source=source, columns=columns_for_table,
2368                               height_policy="auto", width_policy="auto", index_position=None)
2369        export_png(data_table, filename=pngfile)
2370    ######################
2371    @staticmethod
2372    def changeto_nonan_date(df=None, when_end=None, field=None):
2373        if not isinstance(when_end, dt.date):
2374            raise CoaTypeError(' Not a valid data ... ')
2375
2376        boolval = True
2377        j = 0
2378        while (boolval):
2379            boolval = df.loc[df.date == (when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j))][field].dropna().empty
2380            j += 1
2381        if j > 1:
2382            verb(str(when_end) + ': all the value seems to be nan! I will find an other previous date.\n' +
2383                 'Here the date I will take: ' + str(when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)))
2384        return when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)
2385    ######################
2386    @staticmethod
2387    def changeto_nonull_date(df=None,when_end = None, field=None):
2388        if not isinstance(when_end, dt.date):
2389            raise CoaTypeError(' Not a valid data ... ')
2390        boolval = True
2391        j = 0
2392        #df = df.fillna(0)
2393        if all(df[field] == 0):
2394            print('all value is null for all date !')
2395            return when_end
2396        else:
2397            while(boolval):
2398                boolval = all(v == 0. or np.isnan(v) for v in df.loc[df.date == (when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j))][field].values)
2399                j += 1
2400            if j > 1:
2401                verb(str(when_end) + ': all the value seems to be 0! I will find an other previous date.\n' +
2402                     'Here the date I will take: ' + str(when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)))
2403            return when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)
2404    ######################
2405    @staticmethod
2406    def get_utcdate(date):
2407        return (date - dt.date(1970, 1, 1)).total_seconds() * 1000.
2408    ######################
2409    @staticmethod
2410    def test_all_val_null(s):
2411        a = s.to_numpy()
2412        return (a == 0).all()
2413    ######################
2414    @staticmethod
2415    def get_polycoords(geopandasrow):
2416        """
2417        Take a row of a geopandas as an input (i.e : for index, row in geopdwd.iterrows():...)
2418            and returns a tuple (if the geometry is a Polygon) or a list (if the geometry is a multipolygon)
2419            of an exterior.coords
2420        """
2421        geometry = geopandasrow['geometry']
2422        all = []
2423        if geometry.type == 'Polygon':
2424            return list(geometry.exterior.coords)
2425        if geometry.type == 'MultiPolygon':
2426            for ea in geometry.geoms:
2427                all.append(list(ea.exterior.coords))
2428            return all
2429    ######################
2430    @staticmethod
2431    def wgs84_to_web_mercator(tuple_xy):
2432        """
2433        Take a tuple (longitude,latitude) from a coordinate reference system crs=EPSG:4326
2434         and converts it to a  longitude/latitude tuple from to Web Mercator format
2435        """
2436        k = 6378137
2437        x = tuple_xy[0] * (k * np.pi / 180.0)
2438        if tuple_xy[1] == -90:
2439            lat = -89.99
2440        else:
2441            lat = tuple_xy[1]
2442        y = np.log(np.tan((90 + lat) * np.pi / 360.0)) * k
2443        return x, y
2444    ######################
2445    @staticmethod
2446    def rollerJS():
2447        return CustomJSHover(code="""
2448                var value;
2449                 //   if(Math.abs(value)>100000 || Math.abs(value)<0.001)
2450                 //       return value.toExponential(2);
2451                 //   else
2452                 //       return value.toFixed(2);
2453                 if(value>10000 || value <0.01)
2454                    value =  Number.parseFloat(value).toExponential(2);
2455                 else
2456                     value = Number.parseFloat(value).toFixed(2);
2457                return value.toString();
2458                /*  var s = value;
2459                  var s0=s;
2460                  var sp1=s.split(".");
2461                  var p1=sp1[0].length
2462                  if (sp1.length>1) {
2463                    var sp2=s.split("e");
2464                    var p2=sp2[0].length
2465                    var p3=p2
2466                    while(s[p2-1]=="0" && p2>p1) {
2467                        p2=p2-1;
2468                    }
2469                    s=s0.substring(0,p2)+s0.substring(p3,s0.length);
2470                  }
2471                  if (s.split(".")[0].length==s.length-1) {
2472                    s=s.substring(0,s.length-1);
2473                  }
2474                  return s;*/
2475                """)
2476    ######################
2477    @staticmethod
2478    def sparkline(data, figsize=(0.5, 0.5), **kwags):
2479        """
2480        Returns a HTML image tag containing a base64 encoded sparkline style plot
2481        """
2482        data = list(data)
2483        fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=figsize, **kwags)
2484        ax.patch.set_alpha(0.3)
2485        ax.plot(data)
2486        for k,v in ax.spines.items():
2487            v.set_visible(False)
2488        ax.set_xticks([])
2489        ax.set_yticks([])
2490        plt.plot(len(data) - 1, data[len(data) - 1], 'r.')
2491
2492        #ax.fill_between(range(len(data)), data, len(data)*[min(data)], color='green',alpha=0.1)
2493        img = BytesIO()
2494        plt.savefig(img)
2495        img.seek(0)
2496        plt.close()
2497        return 'data:image/png;base64,' + "{}".format(base64.b64encode(img.read()).decode())
2498    ###################### END Static Methods ##################
2499    @staticmethod
2500    def spiral(data, figsize=(0.5, 0.5), **kwags):
2501        """
2502        Returns a HTML image tag containing a base64 encoded spiral style plot
2503        https://github.com/emilienschultz/researchnotebooks/blob/master/20220116%20-%20Visualisation%20polaire%20cas%20COVID-19.ipynb
2504        """
2505        data["date"] = pd.to_datetime(data["date"])
2506        # Utiliser des méthodes de l'objet date de Pandas pour créer de nouvelles colonnes
2507        data["dayofyear"] = data["date"].dt.dayofyear # j'ai cherché comment faire dayofyear et il se trouve qu'il y a une fonction
2508        data["year"] = data["date"].dt.year
2509
2510        K = 2*data['cases'].max()
2511        data["dayofyear_angle"] = data["dayofyear"]*2 * np.pi/365 # gérer plus finement l'année bissextile
2512        data["r_baseline"] = data.apply(lambda x : ((x["year"]-2020)*2 * np.pi + x["dayofyear_angle"])*K,axis=1)
2513
2514        E = 8 # facteur d'expansion des données
2515        data["r_cas_sup"] = data.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] + E*x["cases"],axis=1)
2516        data["r_cas_inf"] = data.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] - E*x["cases"],axis=1)
2517
2518        fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'},figsize=(1,1))
2519
2520        #ax.set_xticklabels(['     january', '', 'april', '', 'july    ', '', 'october', ''])
2521        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_baseline"])
2522        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_sup"],color="black")
2523        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_inf"],color="black")
2524
2525        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_sup"],color="lightblue")
2526        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_inf"],color="lightblue")
2527
2528        ax.fill_between(data["dayofyear_angle"],data["r_baseline"], data["r_cas_sup"],color="lightblue")
2529        ax.fill_between(data["dayofyear_angle"],data["r_baseline"], data["r_cas_inf"],color="lightblue")
2530        ax.set_rticks([])
2531        ax.grid(False)
2532        ax.set_xticklabels([])
2533        ax.set_yticklabels([])
2534        #ax.fill_between(range(len(data)), data, len(data)*[min(data)], color='green',alpha=0.1)
2535        img = BytesIO()
2536        plt.savefig(img)
2537        img.seek(0)
2538        plt.close()
2539        return 'data:image/png;base64,' + "{}".format(base64.b64encode(img.read()).decode())
width_height_default = [500, 380]
MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED = 24
class CocoDisplay: 
 120class CocoDisplay:
 121    def __init__(self, db=None, geo = None):
 122        verb("Init of CocoDisplay() with db=" + str(db))
 123        self.database_name = db
 124        self.dbld = _db_list_dict
 125        self.lcolors = Category20[20]
 126        self.scolors = Category10[5]
 127        self.pycoageopandas = False
 128        self.ax_type = ['linear', 'log']
 129        self.geom = []
 130        self.geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame()
 131        self.location_geometry = None
 132        self.boundary_metropole = None
 133        self.listfigs = []
 134        self.options_stats  = ['when','input','input_field']
 135        self.options_charts = [ 'bins']
 136        self.options_front = ['where','option','which','what','visu']
 137        self.available_tiles = ['openstreet','esri','stamen']
 138        self.available_modes = ['mouse','vline','hline']
 139        self.uptitle, self.subtitle = ' ',' '
 140
 141        self.dfigure_default = {'plot_height':width_height_default[1] ,'plot_width':width_height_default[0],'title':None,'textcopyright':'default'}
 142        self.dvisu_default = {'mode':'mouse','tile':self.available_tiles[0],'orientation':'horizontal','cursor_date':None,'maplabel':None,'guideline':False}
 143
 144        self.when_beg = dt.date(1, 1, 1)
 145        self.when_end = dt.date(1, 1, 1)
 146
 147        self.alloptions =  self.options_stats + self.options_charts + self.options_front + list(self.dfigure_default.keys()) +\
 148                           list(self.dvisu_default.keys()) + ['resumetype']
 149
 150        self.iso3country = self.dbld[self.database_name][0]
 151        self.granularity = self.dbld[self.database_name][1]
 152        self.namecountry = self.dbld[self.database_name][2]
 153        try:
 154            if self.granularity != 'nation':
 155                self.geo = coge.GeoCountry(self.iso3country)
 156                if self.granularity == 'region':
 157                    self.location_geometry = self.geo.get_region_list()[['code_region', 'name_region', 'geometry']]
 158                    self.location_geometry = self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
 159                    if self.iso3country == 'PRT':
 160                         tmp=self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
 161                         tmp = tmp.loc[tmp.code_region=='PT.99']
 162                         self.boundary_metropole =tmp['geometry'].total_bounds
 163                    if self.iso3country == 'FRA':
 164                         tmp=self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
 165                         tmp = tmp.loc[tmp.code_region=='999']
 166                         self.boundary_metropole =tmp['geometry'].total_bounds
 167                elif self.granularity == 'subregion':
 168                    list_dep_metro = None
 169                    self.location_geometry = self.geo.get_subregion_list()[['code_subregion', 'name_subregion', 'geometry']]
 170                    self.location_geometry = self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_subregion': 'where'})
 171            else:
 172                   self.geo=coge.GeoManager('name')
 173                   geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame()#crs="EPSG:4326")
 174                   info = coge.GeoInfo()
 175                   allcountries = self.geo.get_GeoRegion().get_countries_from_region('world')
 176                   geopan['where'] = [self.geo.to_standard(c)[0] for c in allcountries]
 177                   geopan = info.add_field(field=['geometry'],input=geopan ,geofield='where')
 178                   geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame(geopan, geometry=geopan.geometry, crs="EPSG:4326")
 179                   geopan = geopan[geopan['where'] != 'Antarctica']
 180                   geopan = geopan.dropna().reset_index(drop=True)
 181                   self.location_geometry  = geopan
 182        except:
 183            raise CoaTypeError('What data base are you looking for ?')
 184
 185    ''' FIGURE COMMUN FOR ALL '''
 186    def standardfig(self, **kwargs):
 187        """
 188         Create a standard Bokeh figure, with pycoa.fr copyright, used in all the bokeh charts
 189         """
 190        plot_width = kwargs.get('plot_width', self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
 191        plot_height = kwargs.get('plot_height', self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
 192        textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', self.dfigure_default['textcopyright'])
 193
 194        if textcopyright  == 'default':
 195                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr (data from: {})'.format(self.database_name)
 196        else:
 197                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr ' + textcopyright
 198
 199        citation = Label(x=0.65 * plot_width - len(textcopyright), y=0.01 * plot_height,
 200                                          x_units='screen', y_units='screen',
 201                                          text_font_size='1.5vh', background_fill_color='white', background_fill_alpha=.75,
 202                                          text=textcopyright)
 203
 204        for i in list(self.dvisu_default.keys())  + self.options_front + self.options_charts + ['textcopyright'] + self.options_stats + ['date_slider']:
 205            if i in kwargs.keys():
 206                kwargs.pop(i)
 207        kwargs.pop('title')
 208        fig = figure(**kwargs, tools=['save', 'box_zoom,reset'], toolbar_location="right")
 209        #fig.add_layout(citation)
 210        fig.add_layout(Title(text=self.uptitle, text_font_size="10pt"), 'above')
 211        if 'innerdecomap' not in inspect.stack()[1].function:
 212            fig.add_layout(Title(text=self.subtitle, text_font_size="8pt", text_font_style="italic"), 'below')
 213        return fig
 214
 215    def get_listfigures(self):
 216        return  self.listfigs
 217
 218    def set_listfigures(self,fig):
 219            if not isinstance(fig,list):
 220                fig = [fig]
 221            self.listfigs = fig
 222    ''' WRAPPER COMMUN FOR ALL'''
 223    def decowrapper(func):
 224        '''
 225            Main decorator it mainly deals with arg testings
 226        '''
 227        @wraps(func)
 228        def wrapper(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 229            """
 230            Parse a standard input, return :
 231                - pandas: with location keyword (eventually force a column named 'where' to 'where')
 232                - kwargs:
 233                    * keys = [plot_width, plot_width, title, when, title_temporal,bins, what, which]
 234            Note that method used only the needed variables, some of them are useless
 235            """
 236            if not isinstance(input, pd.DataFrame):
 237                raise CoaTypeError(input + 'Must be a pandas, with pycoa structure !')
 238
 239            kwargs_test(kwargs, self.alloptions, 'Bad args used in the display function.')
 240            when = kwargs.get('when', None)
 241            which = kwargs.get('which', input.columns[2])
 242            if isinstance(which,list):
 243                which = input.columns[2]
 244            if input_field and 'cur_' in input_field:
 245                what =  which
 246            else:
 247                 # cumul is the default
 248                what = kwargs.get('what', which)
 249
 250            if input_field is None:
 251                input_field = which
 252
 253            if isinstance(input_field,list):
 254                test = input_field[0]
 255            else:
 256                test = input_field
 257            if input[[test,'date']].isnull().values.all():
 258                raise CoaKeyError('All values for '+ which + ' is nan nor empty')
 259
 260            if type(input)==gpd.geodataframe.GeoDataFrame:
 261               self.pycoageopandas = True
 262
 263            option = kwargs.get('option', None)
 264            bins = kwargs.get('bins', 10)
 265            title = kwargs.get('title', None)
 266            #textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', 'default')
 267            kwargs['plot_width'] = kwargs.get('plot_width', self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
 268            kwargs['plot_height'] = kwargs.get('plot_height', self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
 269
 270            if 'codelocation' and 'clustername' not in input.columns:
 271                input['codelocation'] = input['where']
 272                input['clustername'] = input['where']
 273                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
 274                input['permanentdisplay'] = input['where']
 275            else:
 276                if self.granularity == 'nation' :
 277                    #input['codelocation'] = input['codelocation'].apply(lambda x: str(x).replace('[', '').replace(']', '') if len(x)< 10 else x[0]+'...'+x[-1] )
 278                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.apply(lambda x: x.clustername if self.geo.get_GeoRegion().is_region(x.clustername) else str(x.codelocation), axis = 1)
 279                else:
 280                    if self.granularity == 'subregion' :
 281                        input = input.reset_index(drop=True)
 282                        if isinstance(input['codelocation'].iloc[0],list):
 283                            input['codelocation'] = input['codelocation'].apply(lambda x: str(x).replace("'", '')\
 284                                                         if len(x)<5 else '['+str(x[0]).replace("'", '')+',...,'+str(x[-1]).replace("'", '')+']')
 285
 286                        trad={}
 287                        cluster = input.clustername.unique()
 288                        if isinstance(input['where'].iloc[0],list):
 289                           cluster = [i for i in cluster]
 290                        for i in cluster:
 291                            if i == self.namecountry:
 292                                input['permanentdisplay'] = input.clustername #[self.dbld[self.database_name][2]]*len(input)
 293                            else:
 294                                if self.geo.is_region(i):
 295                                    trad[i] = self.geo.is_region(i)
 296                                elif self.geo.is_subregion(i):
 297                                    trad[i] = self.geo.is_subregion(i)#input.loc[input.clustername==i]['codelocation'].iloc[0]
 298                                else:
 299                                    trad[i] = i
 300                                trad={k:(v[:3]+'...'+v[-3:] if len(v)>8 else v) for k,v in trad.items()}
 301                                if ',' in input.codelocation[0]:
 302                                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.clustername
 303                                else:
 304                                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.codelocation#input.clustername.map(trad)
 305                    elif self.granularity == 'region' :
 306                        if all(i == self.namecountry for i in input.clustername.unique()):
 307                            input['permanentdisplay'] = [self.namecountry]*len(input)
 308                        else:
 309                            input['permanentdisplay'] = input.codelocation
 310                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
 311
 312            maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel', None)
 313            if maplabel and 'unsorted' in maplabel:
 314                pass
 315            else:
 316                input = input.sort_values(by=input_field, ascending = False).reset_index(drop=True)
 317
 318            uniqloc = input.clustername.unique()
 319
 320            if len(uniqloc) < 5:
 321                colors = self.scolors
 322            else:
 323                colors = self.lcolors
 324            colors = itertools.cycle(colors)
 325            dico_colors = {i: next(colors) for i in uniqloc}
 326
 327            input = input.copy()
 328            if not 'colors' in input.columns:
 329                input.loc[:,'colors'] = input['clustername'].map(dico_colors)#(pd.merge(input, country_col, on='where'))
 330
 331            if not isinstance(input_field, list):
 332                  input_field = [input_field]
 333            else:
 334                  input_field = input_field
 335            col2=which
 336            when_beg = input[[col2,'date']].date.min()
 337            when_end = input[[col2,'date']].date.max()
 338
 339            if when:
 340                when_beg, when_end = extract_dates(when)
 341                if when_end > input[[col2,'date']].date.max():
 342                    when_end = input[[col2,'date']].date.max()
 343
 344                if when_beg == dt.date(1, 1, 1):
 345                    when_beg = input[[col2,'date']].date.min()
 346
 347                if not isinstance(when_beg, dt.date):
 348                    raise CoaNoData("With your current cuts, there are no data to plot.")
 349
 350                if when_end <= when_beg:
 351                    print('Requested date below available one, take', when_beg)
 352                    when_end = when_beg
 353                if when_beg > input[[col2,'date']].date.max() or when_end > input[[col2,'date']].date.max():
 354                    raise CoaNoData("No available data after "+str(input[[input_field[0],'date']].date.max()))
 355            when_end_change = when_end
 356
 357            for i in input_field:
 358                if input[i].isnull().all():
 359                    #raise CoaTypeError("Sorry all data are NaN for " + i)
 360                    print("Sorry all data are NaN for " + i)
 361                else:
 362                    when_end_change = min(when_end_change,CocoDisplay.changeto_nonull_date(input, when_end, i))
 363
 364            if func.__name__ not in ['pycoa_date_plot', 'pycoa_plot', 'pycoa_scrollingmenu', 'pycoa_spiral_plot','pycoa_yearly_plot']:
 365                if len(input_field) > 1:
 366                    print(str(input_field) + ' is dim = ' + str(len(input_field)) + '. No effect with ' + func.__name__ + '! Take the first input: ' + input_field[0])
 367                input_field = input_field[0]
 368
 369            if when_end_change != when_end:
 370                when_end = when_end_change
 371
 372            self.when_beg = when_beg
 373            self.when_end = when_end
 374            input = input.loc[(input['date'] >=  self.when_beg) & (input['date'] <=  self.when_end)]
 375
 376            title_temporal = ' (' + 'between ' + when_beg.strftime('%d/%m/%Y') + ' and ' + when_end.strftime('%d/%m/%Y') + ')'
 377            if func.__name__ not in ['pycoa_date_plot', 'pycoa_plot', 'pycoa_scrollingmenu', 'pycoa_spiral_plot','pycoa_yearly_plot']:
 378                title_temporal = ' (' + when_end.strftime('%d/%m/%Y')  + ')'
 379            title_option=''
 380            if option:
 381                if 'sumallandsmooth7' in option:
 382                    if not isinstance(option,list):
 383                        option = ['sumallandsmooth7']
 384                    option.remove('sumallandsmooth7')
 385                    option += ['sumall','smooth7']
 386                title_option = ' (option: ' + str(option)+')'
 387
 388            input_field_tostring = str(input_field).replace('[', '').replace(']', '').replace('\'', '')
 389            whichtitle = which
 390            if 'pop' in input_field_tostring:
 391                whichtitle = input_field_tostring.replace('weekly ','').replace('daily ','')
 392
 393            if 'daily' in input_field_tostring:
 394                titlefig = whichtitle + ', ' + 'day to day difference' + title_option
 395            elif 'weekly' in input_field_tostring:
 396                titlefig = whichtitle + ', ' + 'week to week difference' + title_option
 397            else:
 398                if 'cur_' in  which or 'idx_' in  which:
 399                    #titlefig = which + ', ' + 'current ' + which.replace('cur_','').replace('idx_','')+ title_option
 400                    titlefig = whichtitle + ', current value' + title_option
 401                else:
 402                    titlefig = whichtitle + ', cumulative'+ title_option
 403
 404            if title:
 405                title = title
 406            else:
 407                title  = titlefig
 408            self.uptitle = title
 409
 410            textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', None)
 411            if textcopyright:
 412                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr ' + textcopyright + title_temporal
 413                kwargs.pop('textcopyright')
 414            else:
 415                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr data from: {}'.format(self.database_name)+' '+title_temporal
 416
 417            self.subtitle = textcopyright
 418            kwargs['title'] = title+title_temporal
 419            return func(self, input, input_field, **kwargs)
 420        return wrapper
 421
 422    @decowrapper
 423    def pycoa_resume_data(self, input, input_field, **kwargs):
 424        loc=list(input['clustername'].unique())
 425        input['cases'] = input[input_field]
 426        resumetype = kwargs.get('resumetype','spiral')
 427        if resumetype == 'spiral':
 428            dspiral={i:CocoDisplay.spiral(input.loc[ (input.clustername==i) &
 429                        (input.date >= self.when_beg) &
 430                        (input.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')) for i in loc}
 431            input['resume']=input['clustername'].map(dspiral)
 432        elif resumetype == 'spark':
 433            spark={i:CocoDisplay.sparkline(input.loc[ (input.clustername==i) &
 434                        (input.date >= self.when_beg) &
 435                        (input.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')) for i in loc}
 436            input['resume']=input['clustername'].map(spark)
 437        else:
 438            raise CoaError('pycoa_resume_data can use spiral or spark ... here what ?')
 439        input = input.loc[input.date==input.date.max()].reset_index(drop=True)
 440        def path_to_image_html(path):
 441            return '<img src="'+ path + '" width="60" >'
 442
 443        input=input.drop(columns=['permanentdisplay','rolloverdisplay','colors','cases'])
 444        input=input.apply(lambda x: x.round(2) if x.name in [input_field,'daily','weekly'] else x)
 445        if isinstance(input['where'][0], list):
 446            col=[i for i in list(input.columns) if i not in ['clustername','where','codelocation']]
 447            col.insert(0,'clustername')
 448            input = input[col]
 449            input=input.set_index('clustername')
 450        else:
 451           input = input.drop(columns='clustername')
 452           input=input.set_index('where')
 453
 454        return input.to_html(escape=False,formatters=dict(resume=path_to_image_html))
 455
 456    ''' DECORATORS FOR PLOT: DATE, VERSUS, SCROLLINGMENU '''
 457    def decoplot(func):
 458        """
 459        decorator for plot purpose
 460        """
 461        @wraps(func)
 462        def inner_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 463            mode = kwargs.get('mode', None)
 464            if mode:
 465                mode = mode
 466            else:
 467                mode = self.dvisu_default['mode']
 468            if mode not in self.available_modes:
 469                raise CoaTypeError('Don\'t know the mode wanted. So far:' + str(self.available_modes))
 470            kwargs['mode'] = mode
 471
 472            if 'where' in input.columns:
 473                location_ordered_byvalues = list(
 474                    input.loc[input.date == self.when_end].sort_values(by=input_field, ascending=False)['clustername'].unique())
 475                input = input.copy()  # needed to avoid warning
 476                #input[inputtmp['clustername']] = pd.Categorical(input.clustername,
 477                #                                        categories=location_ordered_byvalues, ordered=True)
 478                input.loc[:,'clustername'] = pd.Categorical(input.clustername,
 479                                                       categories=location_ordered_byvalues, ordered=True)
 480
 481                input = input.sort_values(by=['clustername', 'date']).reset_index(drop = True)
 482
 483                if func.__name__ != 'pycoa_scrollingmenu' :
 484                    if len(location_ordered_byvalues) >= MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED:
 485                        input = input.loc[input.clustername.isin(location_ordered_byvalues[:MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED])]
 486                list_max = []
 487                for i in input_field:
 488                    list_max.append(max(input.loc[input.clustername.isin(location_ordered_byvalues)][i]))
 489                if len([x for x in list_max if not np.isnan(x)]) > 0:
 490                    amplitude = (np.nanmax(list_max) - np.nanmin(list_max))
 491                    if amplitude > 10 ** 4:
 492                        self.ax_type.reverse()
 493                if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_scrollingmenu' :
 494                    if isinstance(input_field,list):
 495                        if len(input_field) > 1:
 496                            print(str(input_field) + ' is dim = ' + str(len(input_field)) + '. No effect with ' + func.__name__ + '! Take the first input: ' + input_field[0])
 497                        input_field = input_field[0]
 498                    if self.dbld[self.database_name][1] == 'nation' and self.dbld[self.database_name][0] != 'WW':
 499                        func.__name__ = 'pycoa_date_plot'
 500            return func(self, input, input_field, **kwargs)
 501        return inner_plot
 502
 503    ''' PLOT VERSUS '''
 504    @decowrapper
 505    @decoplot
 506    def pycoa_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None ,**kwargs):
 507        '''
 508        -----------------
 509        Create a versus plot according to arguments.
 510        See help(pycoa_plot).
 511        Keyword arguments
 512        -----------------
 513        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
 514        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
 515        - input_field = if None take second element. It should be a list dim=2. Moreover the 2 variables must be present
 516        in the DataFrame considered.
 517        - plot_heigh = width_height_default[1]
 518        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
 519        - title = None
 520        - textcopyright = default
 521        - mode = mouse
 522        - cursor_date = None if True
 523                - orientation = horizontal
 524        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
 525                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
 526                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
 527                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
 528                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
 529        '''
 530        if len(input_field) != 2:
 531            raise CoaTypeError('Two variables are needed to plot a versus chart ... ')
 532        panels = []
 533        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
 534        if self.get_listfigures():
 535            self.set_listfigures([])
 536        listfigs=[]
 537        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
 538            standardfig = self.standardfig( x_axis_label = input_field[0], y_axis_label = input_field[1],
 539                                                y_axis_type = axis_type, **kwargs )
 540
 541            standardfig.add_tools(HoverTool(
 542                tooltips=[('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'),
 543                          (input_field[0], '@{casesx}' + '{custom}'),
 544                          (input_field[1], '@{casesy}' + '{custom}')],
 545                formatters={'where': 'printf', '@{casesx}': cases_custom, '@{casesy}': cases_custom,
 546                            '@date': 'datetime'}, mode = kwargs['mode'],
 547                point_policy="snap_to_data"))  # ,PanTool())
 548
 549            for loc in input.clustername.unique():
 550                pandaloc = input.loc[input.clustername == loc].sort_values(by='date', ascending=True)
 551                pandaloc.rename(columns={input_field[0]: 'casesx', input_field[1]: 'casesy'}, inplace=True)
 552                standardfig.line(x='casesx', y='casesy',
 553                                 source=ColumnDataSource(pandaloc), legend_label=pandaloc.clustername.iloc[0],
 554                                 color=pandaloc.colors.iloc[0], line_width=3, hover_line_width=4)
 555
 556            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = "12px"
 557            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title=axis_type)
