1985                         when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
1986                         if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
1987                         if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
1988            - tile : tile
1989            - maplabel: False
1990        '''
1991        date_slider = kwargs['date_slider']
1992        maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel',self.dvisu_default['maplabel'])
1993        min_col, max_col, min_col_non0 = 3*[0.]
1994        try:
1995            if date_slider:
1996                min_col, max_col = CocoDisplay.min_max_range(np.nanmin(geopdwd['cases']),
1997                                                         np.nanmax(geopdwd['cases']))
1998                min_col_non0 = (np.nanmin(geopdwd.loc[geopdwd['cases']>0.]['cases']))
1999            else:
2000                min_col, max_col = CocoDisplay.min_max_range(np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),
2001                                                         np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered['cases']))
2002                min_col_non0 = (np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered.loc[geopdwd_filtered['cases']>0.]['cases']))
2003        except ValueError:  #raised if `geopdwd_filtered` is empty.
2004            pass
2005        #min_col, max_col = np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered['cases'])
2006
2007        json_data = json.dumps(json.loads(geopdwd_filtered.to_json()))
2008        geopdwd_filtered = GeoJSONDataSource(geojson=json_data)
2009
2010        invViridis256 = Viridis256[::-1]
2011        if maplabel and 'log' in maplabel:
2012            color_mapper = LogColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col_non0, high=max_col, nan_color='#ffffff')
2013        else:
2014            color_mapper = LinearColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col, high=max_col, nan_color='#ffffff')
2015        color_bar = ColorBar(color_mapper=color_mapper, label_standoff=4, bar_line_cap='round',
2016                             border_line_color=None, location=(0, 0), orientation='horizontal', ticker=BasicTicker())
2017        color_bar.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=True, precision=1, power_limit_low=int(max_col))
2018
2019        if maplabel and 'label%' in maplabel:
2020            color_bar.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=False)
2021            color_bar.formatter = NumeralTickFormatter(format="0.0%")
2022
2023        standardfig.add_layout(color_bar, 'below')
2024        standardfig.add_layout(Title(text=self.subtitle, text_font_size="8pt", text_font_style="italic"), 'below')
2025        if date_slider:
2026            allcases_location, allcases_dates = pd.DataFrame(), pd.DataFrame()
2027            allcases_location = geopdwd.groupby('where')['cases'].apply(list)
2028            geopdwd_tmp = geopdwd.drop_duplicates(subset = ['where']).drop(columns = 'cases')
2029            geopdwd_tmp = pd.merge(geopdwd_tmp, allcases_location, on = 'where')
2030            geopdwd_tmp  = geopdwd_tmp.drop_duplicates(subset = ['clustername'])
2031            geopdwd_tmp = ColumnDataSource(geopdwd_tmp.drop(columns=['geometry']))
2032
2033            sourcemaplabel.data['rolloverdisplay'] = sourcemaplabel.data['clustername']
2034
2035            callback = CustomJS(args =  dict(source = geopdwd_tmp, source_filter = geopdwd_filtered,
2036                                          date_sliderjs = date_slider, title=standardfig.title,
2037                                          color_mapperjs = color_mapper, maplabeljs = sourcemaplabel),
2038                        code = """
2039                        var ind_date_max = (date_sliderjs.end-date_sliderjs.start)/(24*3600*1000);
2040                        var ind_date = (date_sliderjs.value-date_sliderjs.start)/(24*3600*1000);
2041                        var new_cases = [];
2042                        var dict = {};
2043                        var iloop = source_filter.data['clustername'].length;
2044
2045                        function form(value) {
2046                             if(value>10000 || value <0.01)
2047                                value =  Number.parseFloat(value).toExponential(2);
2048                             else
2049                                 value = Number.parseFloat(value).toFixed(2);
2050                            return value;
2051                         }
2052                        for (var i = 0; i < source.get_length(); i++)
2053                        {
2054                                var val=form(source.data['cases'][i][ind_date_max-ind_date]);
2055                                new_cases.push(val);
2056                        }
2057                        if(source.get_length() == 1 && iloop>1)
2058                            for(var i = 0; i < iloop; i++)
2059                                for(var j = 0; j < new_cases.length; j++){
2060                                source_filter.data['cases'][i][j] = new_cases[j];
2061                                }
2062                        else{
2063                            source_filter.data['cases'] = new_cases;
2064                            }
2065
2066                        if (maplabeljs.get_length() !== 0){
2067                            maplabeljs.data['cases'] = source_filter.data['cases'];
2068                            }
2069                        for (var i = 0; i < maplabeljs.get_length(); i++)
2070                        {
2071                            maplabeljs.data['cases'][i] = form(maplabeljs.data['cases'][i]).toString();
2072                            maplabeljs.data['rolloverdisplay'][i] = source_filter.data['rolloverdisplay'][i];
2073                        }
2074
2075                        var tmp = title.text;
2076                        tmp = tmp.slice(0, -11);
2077                        var dateconverted = new Date(date_sliderjs.value);
2078                        var dd = String(dateconverted.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
2079                        var mm = String(dateconverted.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0'); //January is 0!
2080                        var yyyy = dateconverted.getFullYear();
2081                        var dmy = dd + '/' + mm + '/' + yyyy;
2082                        title.text = tmp + dmy+")";
2083
2084                        if (maplabeljs.get_length() !== 0)
2085                            maplabeljs.change.emit();
2086
2087                        color_mapperjs.high=Math.max.apply(Math, new_cases);
2088                        color_mapperjs.low=Math.min.apply(Math, new_cases);
2089                        console.log(maplabeljs.data['cases']);
2090                        source_filter.change.emit();
2091                    """)
2092            date_slider.js_on_change('value', callback)
2093            # Set up Play/Pause button/toggle JS
2094            date_list = pd.date_range(geopdwd.date.min(),geopdwd.date.max()-dt.timedelta(days=1),freq='d').to_list()
2095            indexCDS = ColumnDataSource(dict(date=date_list))
2096            toggl_js = CustomJS(args=dict(date_slider=date_slider,indexCDS=indexCDS),code="""
2097            // A little lengthy but it works for me, for this problem, in this version.
2098                var check_and_iterate = function(date){
2099                    var slider_val = date_slider.value;
2100                    var toggle_val = cb_obj.active;
2101                    if(toggle_val == false) {
2102                        cb_obj.label = '► Play';
2103                        clearInterval(looop);
2104                        }
2105                    else if(slider_val == date[date.length - 1]) {
2106                        cb_obj.label = '► Play';
2107                        //date_slider.value = date[0];
2108                        cb_obj.active = false;
2109                        clearInterval(looop);
2110                        }
2111                    else if(slider_val !== date[date.length - 1]){
2112                        date_slider.value = date.filter((item) => item > slider_val)[0];
2113                        }
2114                    else {
2115                    clearInterval(looop);
2116                        }
2117                }
2118                if(cb_obj.active == false){
2119                    cb_obj.label = '► Play';
2120                    clearInterval(looop);
2121                }
2122                else {
2123                    cb_obj.label = '❚❚ Pause';
2124                    var looop = setInterval(check_and_iterate, 10, indexCDS.data['date']);
2125                };
2126            """)
2127
2128            toggl = Toggle(label='► Play',active=False, button_type="success",height=30,width=10)
2129            toggl.js_on_change('active',toggl_js)
2130
2131
2132        standardfig.xaxis.visible = False
2133        standardfig.yaxis.visible = False
2134        standardfig.xgrid.grid_line_color = None
2135        standardfig.ygrid.grid_line_color = None
2136        standardfig.patches('xs', 'ys', source = geopdwd_filtered,
2137                            fill_color = {'field': 'cases', 'transform': color_mapper},
2138                            line_color = 'black', line_width = 0.25, fill_alpha = 1)
2139        if maplabel:
2140            if 'text' in maplabel or 'textinteger' in maplabel:
2141
2142                if 'textinteger' in maplabel:
2143                    sourcemaplabel.data['cases'] = sourcemaplabel.data['cases'].astype(float).astype(int).astype(str)
2144                labels = LabelSet(
2145                    x = 'centroidx',
2146                    y = 'centroidy',
2147                    text = 'cases',
2148                    source = sourcemaplabel, text_font_size='10px',text_color='white',background_fill_color='grey',background_fill_alpha=0.5)
2149                standardfig.add_layout(labels)
2150
2151        #cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
2152        callback = CustomJS(code="""
2153        //document.getElementsByClassName('bk-tooltip')[0].style.backgroundColor="transparent";
2154        document.getElementsByClassName('bk-tooltip')[0].style.opacity="0.7";
2155        """ )
2156        tooltips = """
2157                    <b>location: @rolloverdisplay<br>
2158                    cases: @cases{0,0.0} </b>
2159                    """
2160
2161        standardfig.add_tools(HoverTool(tooltips = tooltips,
2162        formatters = {'where': 'printf', 'cases': 'printf',},
2163        point_policy = "snap_to_data",callback=callback))  # ,PanTool())
2164        if date_slider:
2165            standardfig = column(date_slider, standardfig,toggl)
2166        self.pycoageopandas = False
2167        return standardfig
2168
2169    ''' PIMPMAP BOKEH '''
2170    @decowrapper
2171    @decohistomap
2172    @decopycoageo
2173    @decomap
2174    def pycoa_pimpmap(self, geopdwd, geopdwd_filtered, sourcemaplabel, standardfig,**kwargs):
2175        '''
2176            -----------------
2177            Create a bokeh map with pimpline label and with to arguments.
2178            See help(pycoa_histo).
2179            Keyword arguments
2180            -----------------
2181            - srcfiltered : A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
2182            |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
2183            - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
2184            - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
2185            - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
2186            - title = None
2187            - textcopyright = default
2188            - mode = mouse
2189            - cursor_date = None if True
2190                    - orientation = horizontal
2191            - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
2192                         Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
2193                         when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
2194                         if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
2195                         if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
2196            - tile : tile
2197            - maplabel: False
2198        '''
2199        standardfig.xaxis.visible = False
2200        standardfig.yaxis.visible = False
2201        standardfig.xgrid.grid_line_color = None
2202        standardfig.ygrid.grid_line_color = None
2203
2204        min_col, max_col = CocoDisplay.min_max_range(np.nanmin(geopdwd_filtered['cases']),
2205                                                     np.nanmax(geopdwd_filtered['cases']))
2206
2207        json_data = json.dumps(json.loads(geopdwd_filtered.to_json()))
2208        geopdwd_filtered = GeoJSONDataSource(geojson=json_data)
2209
2210        invViridis256 = Viridis256[::-1]
2211        color_mapper = LinearColorMapper(palette=invViridis256, low=min_col, high=max_col, nan_color='#ffffff')
2212        color_bar = ColorBar(color_mapper=color_mapper, label_standoff=4,
2213                             border_line_color=None, location=(0, 0), orientation='horizontal', ticker=BasicTicker())
2214        color_bar.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=True, precision=1, power_limit_low=int(max_col))
2215        standardfig.add_layout(color_bar, 'below')
2216        standardfig.patches('xs', 'ys', source = geopdwd_filtered,
2217                                    fill_color = {'field': 'cases', 'transform': color_mapper},
2218                                    line_color = 'black', line_width = 0.25, fill_alpha = 1)
2219        standardfig.image_url(url='pimpmap', x='centroidx', y='centroidy',source=sourcemaplabel,anchor="center")
2220        return standardfig
2221    ######################
2222    def tiles_list(self):
2223        return self.available_tiles
2224    ###################### BEGIN Static Methods ##################
2225    @staticmethod
2226    def convert_tile(tilename, which = 'bokeh'):
2227        ''' Return tiles url according to folium or bokeh resquested'''
2228        tile = 'openstreet'
2229        if tilename == 'openstreet':
2230            if which == 'folium':
2231                tile = r'https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png'
2232            else:
2233                tile = r'http://c.tile.openstreetmap.org/{Z}/{X}/{Y}.png'
2234        elif tilename == 'positron':
2235            print('Problem with positron tile (huge http resquest need to check), esri is then used ...')
2236            tile = r'https://server.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/World_Imagery/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}.png'
2237        #    tile = 'https://tiles.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_all/{z}/{x}/{y}.png'
2238        elif tilename == 'esri':
2239            tile = r'https://server.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/World_Imagery/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}.png'
2240        elif tilename == 'stamen':
2241            tile = r'http://tile.stamen.com/toner/{z}/{x}/{y}.png'
2242        else:
2243            print('Don\'t know you tile ... take default one: ')
2244        return tile
2245    #####################
2246    @staticmethod
2247    def dict_shorten_loc(toshort):
2248        '''
2249            return a shorten name location
2250        '''
2251        s = []
2252        if type(toshort) == np.ndarray:
2253            toshort = list(toshort)
2254            toshort = [toshort]
2255            s = ''
2256        elif type(toshort) == str:
2257            toshort = [toshort]
2258            s = ''
2259        #if type(toshort) != list:
2260        #    print('That is weird ...', toshort, 'not str nor list')
2261        for val in toshort:
2262            if not isinstance(val,str):
2263                val= str(val)
2264            if type(val) == list:
2265                val = val[0]
2266            if val.find(',') == -1:
2267                A = val
2268            else:
2269                txt = val.split(',')
2270                if len(txt[0]) < 4 and len(txt[-1]) < 4:
2271                    A = [txt[0] + '...' + txt[-1]]
2272                else:
2273                    A = txt[0][:5] + '...' + txt[-1][-5:]
2274            if type(s) == list:
2275                s.append(A)
2276            else:
2277                s = A
2278            if isinstance(s, list):
2279                s=s[0]
2280        return s
2281    ######################
2282    @staticmethod
2283    def bokeh_legend(bkfigure):
2284        toggle_legend_js = CustomJS(args=dict(leg=bkfigure.legend[0]),
2285                                    code="""
2286        if(leg.visible)
2287        {
2288            leg.visible = false;
2289        }
2290        else
2291        {
2292            leg.visible = true;
2293        }
2294        """)
2295        bkfigure.js_on_event(events.DoubleTap, toggle_legend_js)
2296    ######################
2297    @staticmethod
2298    def min_max_range(a_min, a_max):
2299        """ Return a cleverly rounded min and max giving raw min and raw max of data.
2300        Usefull for hist range and colormap
2301        """
2302        min_p = 0
2303        max_p = 0
2304        if a_min != 0:
2305            min_p = math.floor(math.log10(math.fabs(a_min)))  # power
2306        if a_max != 0:
2307            max_p = math.floor(math.log10(math.fabs(a_max)))
2308
2309        if a_min == 0:
2310            if a_max == 0:
2311                p = 0
2312            else:
2313                p = max_p
2314        else:
2315            if a_max == 0:
2316                p = min_p
2317            else:
2318                p = max(min_p, max_p)
2319
2320        if a_min != 0:
2321            min_r = math.floor(a_min / 10 ** (p - 1)) * 10 ** (p - 1)  # min range rounded
2322        else:
2323            min_r = 0
2324
2325        if a_max != 0:
2326            max_r = math.ceil(a_max / 10 ** (p - 1)) * 10 ** (p - 1)
2327        else:
2328            max_r = 0
2329
2330        if min_r == max_r:
2331            if min_r == 0:
2332                min_r = -1
2333                max_r = 1
2334                k = 0
2335            elif max_r > 0:
2336                k = 0.1
2337            else:
2338                k = -0.1
2339            max_r = (1 + k) * max_r
2340            min_r = (1 - k) * min_r
2341
2342        return (min_r, max_r)
2343    ######################
2344    @staticmethod
2345    def save_map2png(map=None, pngfile='map.png'):
2346        """
2347        Save map as png geckodriver and PIL packages are needed
2348        """
2349        size = width_height_default[0], width_height_default[1]
2350        if pngfile:
2351            pngfile = pngfile
2352        img_data = map._to_png(5)
2353        img = Image.open(io.BytesIO(img_data))
2354        img.thumbnail(size, Image.ANTIALIAS)
2355        img.save(pngfile)
2356        print(pngfile, ' is now save ...')
2357    ######################
2358    @staticmethod
2359    def save_pandas_as_png(df=None, pngfile='pandas.png'):
2360        source = ColumnDataSource(df)
2361        df_columns = [df.index.name]
2362        df_columns.extend(df.columns.values)
2363        columns_for_table = []
2364        for column in df_columns:
2365            if column is not None:
2366                columns_for_table.append(TableColumn(field=column, title=column))
2367                # width_height_default
2368        data_table = DataTable(source=source, columns=columns_for_table,
2369                               height_policy="auto", width_policy="auto", index_position=None)
2370        export_png(data_table, filename=pngfile)
2371    ######################
2372    @staticmethod
2373    def changeto_nonan_date(df=None, when_end=None, field=None):
2374        if not isinstance(when_end, dt.date):
2375            raise CoaTypeError(' Not a valid data ... ')
2376
2377        boolval = True
2378        j = 0
2379        while (boolval):
2380            boolval = df.loc[df.date == (when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j))][field].dropna().empty
2381            j += 1
2382        if j > 1:
2383            verb(str(when_end) + ': all the value seems to be nan! I will find an other previous date.\n' +
2384                 'Here the date I will take: ' + str(when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)))
2385        return when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)
2386    ######################
2387    @staticmethod
2388    def changeto_nonull_date(df=None,when_end = None, field=None):
2389        if not isinstance(when_end, dt.date):
2390            raise CoaTypeError(' Not a valid data ... ')
2391        boolval = True
2392        j = 0
2393        #df = df.fillna(0)
2394        if all(df[field] == 0):
2395            print('all value is null for all date !')
2396            return when_end
2397        else:
2398            while(boolval):
2399                boolval = all(v == 0. or np.isnan(v) for v in df.loc[df.date == (when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j))][field].values)
2400                j += 1
2401            if j > 1:
2402                verb(str(when_end) + ': all the value seems to be 0! I will find an other previous date.\n' +
2403                     'Here the date I will take: ' + str(when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)))
2404            return when_end - dt.timedelta(days=j - 1)
2405    ######################
2406    @staticmethod
2407    def get_utcdate(date):
2408        return (date - dt.date(1970, 1, 1)).total_seconds() * 1000.
2409    ######################
2410    @staticmethod
2411    def test_all_val_null(s):
2412        a = s.to_numpy()
2413        return (a == 0).all()
2414    ######################
2415    @staticmethod
2416    def get_polycoords(geopandasrow):
2417        """
2418        Take a row of a geopandas as an input (i.e : for index, row in geopdwd.iterrows():...)
2419            and returns a tuple (if the geometry is a Polygon) or a list (if the geometry is a multipolygon)
2420            of an exterior.coords
2421        """
2422        geometry = geopandasrow['geometry']
2423        all = []
2424        if geometry.type == 'Polygon':
2425            return list(geometry.exterior.coords)
2426        if geometry.type == 'MultiPolygon':
2427            for ea in geometry.geoms:
2428                all.append(list(ea.exterior.coords))
2429            return all
2430    ######################
2431    @staticmethod
2432    def wgs84_to_web_mercator(tuple_xy):
2433        """
2434        Take a tuple (longitude,latitude) from a coordinate reference system crs=EPSG:4326
2435         and converts it to a  longitude/latitude tuple from to Web Mercator format
2436        """
2437        k = 6378137
2438        x = tuple_xy[0] * (k * np.pi / 180.0)
2439        if tuple_xy[1] == -90:
2440            lat = -89.99
2441        else:
2442            lat = tuple_xy[1]
2443        y = np.log(np.tan((90 + lat) * np.pi / 360.0)) * k
2444        return x, y
2445    ######################
2446    @staticmethod
2447    def rollerJS():
2448        return CustomJSHover(code="""
2449                var value;
2450                 //   if(Math.abs(value)>100000 || Math.abs(value)<0.001)
2451                 //       return value.toExponential(2);
2452                 //   else
2453                 //       return value.toFixed(2);
2454                 if(value>10000 || value <0.01)
2455                    value =  Number.parseFloat(value).toExponential(2);
2456                 else
2457                     value = Number.parseFloat(value).toFixed(2);
2458                return value.toString();
2459                /*  var s = value;
2460                  var s0=s;
2461                  var sp1=s.split(".");
2462                  var p1=sp1[0].length
2463                  if (sp1.length>1) {
2464                    var sp2=s.split("e");
2465                    var p2=sp2[0].length
2466                    var p3=p2
2467                    while(s[p2-1]=="0" && p2>p1) {
2468                        p2=p2-1;
2469                    }
2470                    s=s0.substring(0,p2)+s0.substring(p3,s0.length);
2471                  }
2472                  if (s.split(".")[0].length==s.length-1) {
2473                    s=s.substring(0,s.length-1);
2474                  }
2475                  return s;*/
2476                """)
2477    ######################
2478    @staticmethod
2479    def sparkline(data, figsize=(0.5, 0.5), **kwags):
2480        """
2481        Returns a HTML image tag containing a base64 encoded sparkline style plot
2482        """
2483        data = list(data)
2484        fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=figsize, **kwags)
2485        ax.patch.set_alpha(0.3)
2486        ax.plot(data)
2487        for k,v in ax.spines.items():
2488            v.set_visible(False)
2489        ax.set_xticks([])
2490        ax.set_yticks([])
2491        plt.plot(len(data) - 1, data[len(data) - 1], 'r.')
2492
2493        #ax.fill_between(range(len(data)), data, len(data)*[min(data)], color='green',alpha=0.1)
2494        img = BytesIO()
2495        plt.savefig(img)
2496        img.seek(0)
2497        plt.close()
2498        return 'data:image/png;base64,' + "{}".format(base64.b64encode(img.read()).decode())
2499    ###################### END Static Methods ##################
2500    @staticmethod
2501    def spiral(data, figsize=(0.5, 0.5), **kwags):
2502        """
2503        Returns a HTML image tag containing a base64 encoded spiral style plot
2504        https://github.com/emilienschultz/researchnotebooks/blob/master/20220116%20-%20Visualisation%20polaire%20cas%20COVID-19.ipynb
2505        """
2506        data["date"] = pd.to_datetime(data["date"])
2507        # Utiliser des méthodes de l'objet date de Pandas pour créer de nouvelles colonnes
2508        data["dayofyear"] = data["date"].dt.dayofyear # j'ai cherché comment faire dayofyear et il se trouve qu'il y a une fonction
2509        data["year"] = data["date"].dt.year
2510
2511        K = 2*data['cases'].max()
2512        data["dayofyear_angle"] = data["dayofyear"]*2 * np.pi/365 # gérer plus finement l'année bissextile
2513        data["r_baseline"] = data.apply(lambda x : ((x["year"]-2020)*2 * np.pi + x["dayofyear_angle"])*K,axis=1)
2514
2515        E = 8 # facteur d'expansion des données
2516        data["r_cas_sup"] = data.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] + E*x["cases"],axis=1)
2517        data["r_cas_inf"] = data.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] - E*x["cases"],axis=1)
2518
2519        fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'},figsize=(1,1))
2520
2521        #ax.set_xticklabels(['     january', '', 'april', '', 'july    ', '', 'october', ''])
2522        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_baseline"])
2523        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_sup"],color="black")
2524        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_inf"],color="black")
2525
2526        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_sup"],color="lightblue")
2527        ax.plot(data["dayofyear_angle"], data["r_cas_inf"],color="lightblue")
2528
2529        ax.fill_between(data["dayofyear_angle"],data["r_baseline"], data["r_cas_sup"],color="lightblue")
2530        ax.fill_between(data["dayofyear_angle"],data["r_baseline"], data["r_cas_inf"],color="lightblue")
2531        ax.set_rticks([])
2532        ax.grid(False)
2533        ax.set_xticklabels([])
2534        ax.set_yticklabels([])
2535        #ax.fill_between(range(len(data)), data, len(data)*[min(data)], color='green',alpha=0.1)
2536        img = BytesIO()
2537        plt.savefig(img)
2538        img.seek(0)
2539        plt.close()
2540        return 'data:image/png;base64,' + "{}".format(base64.b64encode(img.read()).decode())
CocoDisplay(db=None, geo=None) 
121    def __init__(self, db=None, geo = None):
122        verb("Init of CocoDisplay() with db=" + str(db))
123        self.database_name = db
124        self.dbld = _db_list_dict
125        self.lcolors = Category20[20]
126        self.scolors = Category10[5]
127        self.pycoageopandas = False
128        self.ax_type = ['linear', 'log']
129        self.geom = []
130        self.geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame()
131        self.location_geometry = None
132        self.boundary_metropole = None
133        self.listfigs = []
134        self.options_stats  = ['when','input','input_field']
135        self.options_charts = [ 'bins']
136        self.options_front = ['where','option','which','what','visu']
137        self.available_tiles = ['openstreet','esri','stamen']
138        self.available_modes = ['mouse','vline','hline']
139        self.uptitle, self.subtitle = ' ',' '
140
141        self.dfigure_default = {'plot_height':width_height_default[1] ,'plot_width':width_height_default[0],'title':None,'textcopyright':'default'}
142        self.dvisu_default = {'mode':'mouse','tile':self.available_tiles[0],'orientation':'horizontal','cursor_date':None,'maplabel':None,'guideline':False}
143
144        self.when_beg = dt.date(1, 1, 1)
145        self.when_end = dt.date(1, 1, 1)
146
147        self.alloptions =  self.options_stats + self.options_charts + self.options_front + list(self.dfigure_default.keys()) +\
148                           list(self.dvisu_default.keys()) + ['resumetype']
149
150        self.iso3country = self.dbld[self.database_name][0]
151        self.granularity = self.dbld[self.database_name][1]
152        self.namecountry = self.dbld[self.database_name][2]
153        try:
154            if self.granularity != 'nation':
155                self.geo = coge.GeoCountry(self.iso3country)
156                if self.granularity == 'region':
157                    self.location_geometry = self.geo.get_region_list()[['code_region', 'name_region', 'geometry']]
158                    self.location_geometry = self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
159                    if self.iso3country == 'PRT':
160                         tmp=self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
161                         tmp = tmp.loc[tmp.code_region=='PT.99']
162                         self.boundary_metropole =tmp['geometry'].total_bounds
163                    if self.iso3country == 'FRA':
164                         tmp=self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_region': 'where'})
165                         tmp = tmp.loc[tmp.code_region=='999']
166                         self.boundary_metropole =tmp['geometry'].total_bounds
167                elif self.granularity == 'subregion':
168                    list_dep_metro = None
169                    self.location_geometry = self.geo.get_subregion_list()[['code_subregion', 'name_subregion', 'geometry']]
170                    self.location_geometry = self.location_geometry.rename(columns={'name_subregion': 'where'})
171            else:
172                   self.geo=coge.GeoManager('name')
173                   geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame()#crs="EPSG:4326")
174                   info = coge.GeoInfo()
175                   allcountries = self.geo.get_GeoRegion().get_countries_from_region('world')
176                   geopan['where'] = [self.geo.to_standard(c)[0] for c in allcountries]
177                   geopan = info.add_field(field=['geometry'],input=geopan ,geofield='where')
178                   geopan = gpd.GeoDataFrame(geopan, geometry=geopan.geometry, crs="EPSG:4326")
179                   geopan = geopan[geopan['where'] != 'Antarctica']
180                   geopan = geopan.dropna().reset_index(drop=True)
181                   self.location_geometry  = geopan
182        except:
183            raise CoaTypeError('What data base are you looking for ?')
database_name

def standardfig(self, **kwargs): 
186    def standardfig(self, **kwargs):
187        """
188         Create a standard Bokeh figure, with pycoa.fr copyright, used in all the bokeh charts
189         """
190        plot_width = kwargs.get('plot_width', self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
191        plot_height = kwargs.get('plot_height', self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
192        textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', self.dfigure_default['textcopyright'])
193
194        if textcopyright  == 'default':
195                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr (data from: {})'.format(self.database_name)
196        else:
197                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr ' + textcopyright
198
199        citation = Label(x=0.65 * plot_width - len(textcopyright), y=0.01 * plot_height,
200                                          x_units='screen', y_units='screen',
201                                          text_font_size='1.5vh', background_fill_color='white', background_fill_alpha=.75,
202                                          text=textcopyright)
203
204        for i in list(self.dvisu_default.keys())  + self.options_front + self.options_charts + ['textcopyright'] + self.options_stats + ['date_slider']:
205            if i in kwargs.keys():
206                kwargs.pop(i)
207        kwargs.pop('title')
208        fig = figure(**kwargs, tools=['save', 'box_zoom,reset'], toolbar_location="right")
209        #fig.add_layout(citation)
210        fig.add_layout(Title(text=self.uptitle, text_font_size="10pt"), 'above')
211        if 'innerdecomap' not in inspect.stack()[1].function:
212            fig.add_layout(Title(text=self.subtitle, text_font_size="8pt", text_font_style="italic"), 'below')
213        return fig

Create a standard Bokeh figure, with pycoa.fr copyright, used in all the bokeh charts

def get_listfigures(self): 
215    def get_listfigures(self):
216        return  self.listfigs
def set_listfigures(self, fig): 
218    def set_listfigures(self,fig):
219            if not isinstance(fig,list):
220                fig = [fig]
221            self.listfigs = fig
def decowrapper(func): 
223    def decowrapper(func):
224        '''
225            Main decorator it mainly deals with arg testings
226        '''
227        @wraps(func)
228        def wrapper(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
229            """
230            Parse a standard input, return :
231                - pandas: with location keyword (eventually force a column named 'where' to 'where')
232                - kwargs:
233                    * keys = [plot_width, plot_width, title, when, title_temporal,bins, what, which]
234            Note that method used only the needed variables, some of them are useless
235            """
236            if not isinstance(input, pd.DataFrame):
237                raise CoaTypeError(input + 'Must be a pandas, with pycoa structure !')
238
239            kwargs_test(kwargs, self.alloptions, 'Bad args used in the display function.')
240            when = kwargs.get('when', None)
241            which = kwargs.get('which', input.columns[2])
242            if isinstance(which,list):
243                which = input.columns[2]
244            if input_field and 'cur_' in input_field:
245                what =  which
246            else:
247                 # cumul is the default
248                what = kwargs.get('what', which)
249
250            if input_field is None:
251                input_field = which
252
253            if isinstance(input_field,list):
254                test = input_field[0]
255            else:
256                test = input_field
257            if input[[test,'date']].isnull().values.all():
258                raise CoaKeyError('All values for '+ which + ' is nan nor empty')
259
260            if type(input)==gpd.geodataframe.GeoDataFrame:
261               self.pycoageopandas = True
262
263            option = kwargs.get('option', None)
264            bins = kwargs.get('bins', 10)
265            title = kwargs.get('title', None)
266            #textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', 'default')
267            kwargs['plot_width'] = kwargs.get('plot_width', self.dfigure_default['plot_width'])
268            kwargs['plot_height'] = kwargs.get('plot_height', self.dfigure_default['plot_height'])
269
270            if 'codelocation' and 'clustername' not in input.columns:
271                input['codelocation'] = input['where']
272                input['clustername'] = input['where']
273                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
274                input['permanentdisplay'] = input['where']
275            else:
276                if self.granularity == 'nation' :
277                    #input['codelocation'] = input['codelocation'].apply(lambda x: str(x).replace('[', '').replace(']', '') if len(x)< 10 else x[0]+'...'+x[-1] )
278                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.apply(lambda x: x.clustername if self.geo.get_GeoRegion().is_region(x.clustername) else str(x.codelocation), axis = 1)
279                else:
280                    if self.granularity == 'subregion' :
281                        input = input.reset_index(drop=True)
282                        if isinstance(input['codelocation'].iloc[0],list):
283                            input['codelocation'] = input['codelocation'].apply(lambda x: str(x).replace("'", '')\
284                                                         if len(x)<5 else '['+str(x[0]).replace("'", '')+',...,'+str(x[-1]).replace("'", '')+']')
285
286                        trad={}
287                        cluster = input.clustername.unique()
288                        if isinstance(input['where'].iloc[0],list):
289                           cluster = [i for i in cluster]
290                        for i in cluster:
291                            if i == self.namecountry:
292                                input['permanentdisplay'] = input.clustername #[self.dbld[self.database_name][2]]*len(input)
293                            else:
294                                if self.geo.is_region(i):
295                                    trad[i] = self.geo.is_region(i)
296                                elif self.geo.is_subregion(i):
297                                    trad[i] = self.geo.is_subregion(i)#input.loc[input.clustername==i]['codelocation'].iloc[0]
298                                else:
299                                    trad[i] = i
300                                trad={k:(v[:3]+'...'+v[-3:] if len(v)>8 else v) for k,v in trad.items()}
301                                if ',' in input.codelocation[0]:
302                                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.clustername
303                                else:
304                                    input['permanentdisplay'] = input.codelocation#input.clustername.map(trad)
305                    elif self.granularity == 'region' :
306                        if all(i == self.namecountry for i in input.clustername.unique()):
307                            input['permanentdisplay'] = [self.namecountry]*len(input)
308                        else:
309                            input['permanentdisplay'] = input.codelocation
310                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
311
312            maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel', None)
313            if maplabel and 'unsorted' in maplabel:
314                pass
315            else:
316                input = input.sort_values(by=input_field, ascending = False).reset_index(drop=True)
317
318            uniqloc = input.clustername.unique()
319
320            if len(uniqloc) < 5:
321                colors = self.scolors
322            else:
323                colors = self.lcolors
324            colors = itertools.cycle(colors)
325            dico_colors = {i: next(colors) for i in uniqloc}
326
327            input = input.copy()
328            if not 'colors' in input.columns:
329                input.loc[:,'colors'] = input['clustername'].map(dico_colors)#(pd.merge(input, country_col, on='where'))
330
331            if not isinstance(input_field, list):
332                  input_field = [input_field]
333            else:
334                  input_field = input_field
335            col2=which
336            when_beg = input[[col2,'date']].date.min()
337            when_end = input[[col2,'date']].date.max()
338
339            if when:
340                when_beg, when_end = extract_dates(when)
341                if when_end > input[[col2,'date']].date.max():
342                    when_end = input[[col2,'date']].date.max()
343
344                if when_beg == dt.date(1, 1, 1):
345                    when_beg = input[[col2,'date']].date.min()
346
347                if not isinstance(when_beg, dt.date):
348                    raise CoaNoData("With your current cuts, there are no data to plot.")
349
350                if when_end <= when_beg:
351                    print('Requested date below available one, take', when_beg)
352                    when_end = when_beg
353                if when_beg > input[[col2,'date']].date.max() or when_end > input[[col2,'date']].date.max():
354                    raise CoaNoData("No available data after "+str(input[[input_field[0],'date']].date.max()))
355            when_end_change = when_end
356
357            for i in input_field:
358                if input[i].isnull().all():
359                    #raise CoaTypeError("Sorry all data are NaN for " + i)
360                    print("Sorry all data are NaN for " + i)
361                else:
362                    when_end_change = min(when_end_change,CocoDisplay.changeto_nonull_date(input, when_end, i))
363
364            if func.__name__ not in ['pycoa_date_plot', 'pycoa_plot', 'pycoa_scrollingmenu', 'pycoa_spiral_plot','pycoa_yearly_plot']:
365                if len(input_field) > 1:
366                    print(str(input_field) + ' is dim = ' + str(len(input_field)) + '. No effect with ' + func.__name__ + '! Take the first input: ' + input_field[0])
367                input_field = input_field[0]
368
369            if when_end_change != when_end:
370                when_end = when_end_change
371
372            self.when_beg = when_beg
373            self.when_end = when_end
374            input = input.loc[(input['date'] >=  self.when_beg) & (input['date'] <=  self.when_end)]
375
376            title_temporal = ' (' + 'between ' + when_beg.strftime('%d/%m/%Y') + ' and ' + when_end.strftime('%d/%m/%Y') + ')'
377            if func.__name__ not in ['pycoa_date_plot', 'pycoa_plot', 'pycoa_scrollingmenu', 'pycoa_spiral_plot','pycoa_yearly_plot']:
378                title_temporal = ' (' + when_end.strftime('%d/%m/%Y')  + ')'
379            title_option=''
380            if option:
381                if 'sumallandsmooth7' in option:
382                    if not isinstance(option,list):
383                        option = ['sumallandsmooth7']
384                    option.remove('sumallandsmooth7')
385                    option += ['sumall','smooth7']
386                title_option = ' (option: ' + str(option)+')'
387
388            input_field_tostring = str(input_field).replace('[', '').replace(']', '').replace('\'', '')
389            whichtitle = which
390            if 'pop' in input_field_tostring:
391                whichtitle = input_field_tostring.replace('weekly ','').replace('daily ','')
392
393            if 'daily' in input_field_tostring:
394                titlefig = whichtitle + ', ' + 'day to day difference' + title_option
395            elif 'weekly' in input_field_tostring:
396                titlefig = whichtitle + ', ' + 'week to week difference' + title_option
397            else:
398                if 'cur_' in  which or 'idx_' in  which:
399                    #titlefig = which + ', ' + 'current ' + which.replace('cur_','').replace('idx_','')+ title_option
400                    titlefig = whichtitle + ', current value' + title_option
401                else:
402                    titlefig = whichtitle + ', cumulative'+ title_option
403
404            if title:
405                title = title
406            else:
407                title  = titlefig
408            self.uptitle = title
409
410            textcopyright = kwargs.get('textcopyright', None)
411            if textcopyright:
412                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr ' + textcopyright + title_temporal
413                kwargs.pop('textcopyright')
414            else:
415                textcopyright = '©pycoa.fr data from: {}'.format(self.database_name)+' '+title_temporal
416
417            self.subtitle = textcopyright
418            kwargs['title'] = title+title_temporal
419            return func(self, input, input_field, **kwargs)
420        return wrapper

Main decorator it mainly deals with arg testings

@decowrapper
def pycoa_resume_data(self, input, input_field, **kwargs): 
422    @decowrapper
423    def pycoa_resume_data(self, input, input_field, **kwargs):
424        loc=list(input['clustername'].unique())
425        input['cases'] = input[input_field]
426        resumetype = kwargs.get('resumetype','spiral')
427        if resumetype == 'spiral':
428            dspiral={i:CocoDisplay.spiral(input.loc[ (input.clustername==i) &
429                        (input.date >= self.when_beg) &
430                        (input.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')) for i in loc}
431            input['resume']=input['clustername'].map(dspiral)
432        elif resumetype == 'spark':
433            spark={i:CocoDisplay.sparkline(input.loc[ (input.clustername==i) &
434                        (input.date >= self.when_beg) &
435                        (input.date <= self.when_end)].sort_values(by='date')) for i in loc}
436            input['resume']=input['clustername'].map(spark)
437        else:
438            raise CoaError('pycoa_resume_data can use spiral or spark ... here what ?')
439        input = input.loc[input.date==input.date.max()].reset_index(drop=True)
440        def path_to_image_html(path):
441            return '<img src="'+ path + '" width="60" >'
442
443        input=input.drop(columns=['permanentdisplay','rolloverdisplay','colors','cases'])
444        input=input.apply(lambda x: x.round(2) if x.name in [input_field,'daily','weekly'] else x)
445        if isinstance(input['where'][0], list):
446            col=[i for i in list(input.columns) if i not in ['clustername','where','codelocation']]
447            col.insert(0,'clustername')
448            input = input[col]
449            input=input.set_index('clustername')
450        else:
451           input = input.drop(columns='clustername')
452           input=input.set_index('where')
453
454        return input.to_html(escape=False,formatters=dict(resume=path_to_image_html))
def decoplot(func): 
457    def decoplot(func):
458        """
459        decorator for plot purpose
460        """
461        @wraps(func)
462        def inner_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
463            mode = kwargs.get('mode', None)
464            if mode:
465                mode = mode
466            else:
467                mode = self.dvisu_default['mode']
468            if mode not in self.available_modes:
469                raise CoaTypeError('Don\'t know the mode wanted. So far:' + str(self.available_modes))
470            kwargs['mode'] = mode
471
472            if 'where' in input.columns:
473                location_ordered_byvalues = list(
474                    input.loc[input.date == self.when_end].sort_values(by=input_field, ascending=False)['clustername'].unique())
475                input = input.copy()  # needed to avoid warning
476                #input[inputtmp['clustername']] = pd.Categorical(input.clustername,
477                #                                        categories=location_ordered_byvalues, ordered=True)
478                input.loc[:,'clustername'] = pd.Categorical(input.clustername,
479                                                       categories=location_ordered_byvalues, ordered=True)
480
481                input = input.sort_values(by=['clustername', 'date']).reset_index(drop = True)
482
483                if func.__name__ != 'pycoa_scrollingmenu' :
484                    if len(location_ordered_byvalues) >= MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED:
485                        input = input.loc[input.clustername.isin(location_ordered_byvalues[:MAXCOUNTRIESDISPLAYED])]
486                list_max = []
487                for i in input_field:
488                    list_max.append(max(input.loc[input.clustername.isin(location_ordered_byvalues)][i]))
489                if len([x for x in list_max if not np.isnan(x)]) > 0:
490                    amplitude = (np.nanmax(list_max) - np.nanmin(list_max))
491                    if amplitude > 10 ** 4:
492                        self.ax_type.reverse()
493                if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_scrollingmenu' :
494                    if isinstance(input_field,list):
495                        if len(input_field) > 1:
496                            print(str(input_field) + ' is dim = ' + str(len(input_field)) + '. No effect with ' + func.__name__ + '! Take the first input: ' + input_field[0])
497                        input_field = input_field[0]
498                    if self.dbld[self.database_name][1] == 'nation' and self.dbld[self.database_name][0] != 'WW':
499                        func.__name__ = 'pycoa_date_plot'
500            return func(self, input, input_field, **kwargs)
501        return inner_plot

decorator for plot purpose

@decowrapper
@decoplot
def pycoa_plot(self, input=None, input_field=None, **kwargs): 
504    @decowrapper
505    @decoplot
506    def pycoa_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None ,**kwargs):
507        '''
508        -----------------
509        Create a versus plot according to arguments.
510        See help(pycoa_plot).
511        Keyword arguments
512        -----------------
513        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
514        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
515        - input_field = if None take second element. It should be a list dim=2. Moreover the 2 variables must be present
516        in the DataFrame considered.
517        - plot_heigh = width_height_default[1]
518        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
519        - title = None
520        - textcopyright = default
521        - mode = mouse
522        - cursor_date = None if True
523                - orientation = horizontal
524        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
525                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
526                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
527                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
528                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
529        '''
530        if len(input_field) != 2:
531            raise CoaTypeError('Two variables are needed to plot a versus chart ... ')
532        panels = []
533        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
534        if self.get_listfigures():
535            self.set_listfigures([])
536        listfigs=[]
537        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
538            standardfig = self.standardfig( x_axis_label = input_field[0], y_axis_label = input_field[1],
539                                                y_axis_type = axis_type, **kwargs )
540
541            standardfig.add_tools(HoverTool(
542                tooltips=[('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'),
543                          (input_field[0], '@{casesx}' + '{custom}'),
544                          (input_field[1], '@{casesy}' + '{custom}')],
545                formatters={'where': 'printf', '@{casesx}': cases_custom, '@{casesy}': cases_custom,
546                            '@date': 'datetime'}, mode = kwargs['mode'],
547                point_policy="snap_to_data"))  # ,PanTool())
548
549            for loc in input.clustername.unique():
550                pandaloc = input.loc[input.clustername == loc].sort_values(by='date', ascending=True)
551                pandaloc.rename(columns={input_field[0]: 'casesx', input_field[1]: 'casesy'}, inplace=True)
552                standardfig.line(x='casesx', y='casesy',
553                                 source=ColumnDataSource(pandaloc), legend_label=pandaloc.clustername.iloc[0],
554                                 color=pandaloc.colors.iloc[0], line_width=3, hover_line_width=4)
555
556            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = "12px"
557            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title=axis_type)
558            panels.append(panel)
559            standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
560
561            standardfig.legend.location = "top_left"
562            listfigs.append(standardfig)
563            CocoDisplay.bokeh_legend(standardfig)
564        self.set_listfigures(listfigs)
565        tabs = Tabs(tabs=panels)
566        return tabs

Create a versus plot according to arguments. See help(pycoa_plot).

Keyword arguments

  • input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
  • input_field = if None take second element. It should be a list dim=2. Moreover the 2 variables must be present in the DataFrame considered.
  • plot_heigh = width_height_default[1]
  • plot_width = width_height_default[0]
  • title = None
  • textcopyright = default
  • mode = mouse
  • cursor_date = None if True
    • orientation = horizontal
  • when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame. Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy. when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy] if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
@decowrapper
@decoplot
def pycoa_date_plot(self, input=None, input_field=None, **kwargs): 
569    @decowrapper
570    @decoplot
571    def pycoa_date_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
572        '''
573        -----------------
574        Create a date plot according to arguments. See help(pycoa_date_plot).
575        Keyword arguments
576        -----------------
577        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
578        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
579        - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
580        - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
581        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
582        - title = None
583        - textcopyright = default
584        - mode = mouse
585        - guideline = False
586        - cursor_date = None if True
587                - orientation = horizontal
588        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
589                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
590                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
591                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
592                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
593        '''
594        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
595        panels = []
596        listfigs = []
597        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
598        if 'which' in kwargs and isinstance(kwargs['which'],list):
599            input_field=kwargs['which']
600        if isinstance(input['rolloverdisplay'].iloc[0],list):
601            input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
602        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
603            standardfig = self.standardfig( y_axis_type = axis_type, x_axis_type = 'datetime',**kwargs)
604            i = 0
605            r_list=[]
606            maxou=-1000
607            lcolors = iter(self.lcolors)
608            line_style = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dotdash','dashdot']
609            maxou,minou=0,0
610            tooltips=[]
611            for val in input_field:
612                for loc in list(input.clustername.unique()):
613                    input_filter = input.loc[input.clustername == loc].reset_index(drop = True)
614                    src = ColumnDataSource(input_filter)
615                    leg = input_filter.clustername[0]
616                    #leg = input_filter.permanentdisplay[0]
617                    if len(input_field)>1:
618                        leg = input_filter.permanentdisplay[0] + ', ' + val
619                    if len(list(input.clustername.unique())) == 1:
620                        color = next(lcolors)
621                    else:
622                        color = input_filter.colors[0]
623                    r = standardfig.line(x = 'date', y = val, source = src,
624                                     color = color, line_width = 3,
625                                     legend_label = leg,
626                                     hover_line_width = 4, name = val, line_dash=line_style[i%4])
627                    r_list.append(r)
628                    maxou=max(maxou,np.nanmax(input_filter[val].values))
629                    minou=max(minou,np.nanmin(input_filter[val].values))
630
631                    if minou <0.01:
632                        tooltips.append([('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), (r.name, '@$name')])
633                    else:
634                        tooltips.append([('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), (r.name, '@$name{0,0.0}')])
635                    if isinstance(tooltips,tuple):
636                        tooltips = tooltips[0]
637                i += 1
638            for i,r in enumerate(r_list):
639                label = r.name
640                tt = tooltips[i]
641                formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@date': 'datetime', '@name': 'printf'}
642                hover=HoverTool(tooltips = tt, formatters = formatters, point_policy = "snap_to_data", mode = kwargs['mode'], renderers=[r])  # ,PanTool())
643                standardfig.add_tools(hover)
644                if guideline:
645                    cross= CrosshairTool()
646                    standardfig.add_tools(cross)
647
648            if axis_type == 'linear':
649                if maxou  < 1e4 :
650                    standardfig.yaxis.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=False)
651
652            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = "12px"
653            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title = axis_type)
654            panels.append(panel)
655            standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
656
657            standardfig.legend.location  = "top_left"
658            standardfig.legend.click_policy="hide"
659            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = '8pt'
660            if len(input_field) > 1 and len(input_field)*len(input.clustername.unique())>16:
661                standardfig.legend.visible=False
662            standardfig.xaxis.formatter = DatetimeTickFormatter(
663                days = ["%d/%m/%y"], months = ["%d/%m/%y"], years = ["%b %Y"])
664            CocoDisplay.bokeh_legend(standardfig)
665            listfigs.append(standardfig)
666        self.set_listfigures(listfigs)
667        tabs = Tabs(tabs = panels)
668        return tabs

Create a date plot according to arguments. See help(pycoa_date_plot).

Keyword arguments

  • input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
  • input_field = if None take second element could be a list
  • plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
  • plot_width = width_height_default[0]
  • title = None
  • textcopyright = default
  • mode = mouse
  • guideline = False
  • cursor_date = None if True
    • orientation = horizontal
  • when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame. Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy. when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy] if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
@decowrapper
@decoplot
def pycoa_spiral_plot(self, input=None, input_field=None, **kwargs): 
671    @decowrapper
672    @decoplot
673    def pycoa_spiral_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
674        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
675        panels = []
676        listfigs = []
677        if isinstance(input['rolloverdisplay'].iloc[0],list):
678            input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
679        borne = 300
680        kwargs.pop('plot_width')
681        standardfig = self.standardfig(y_axis_type = None, x_axis_type = None,
682        width=kwargs['plot_height'], x_range=[-borne, borne], y_range=[-borne, borne], match_aspect=True,**kwargs)
683
684        if len(input.clustername.unique()) > 1 :
685            print('Can only display spiral for ONE location. I took the first one:', input.clustername[0])
686            input = input.loc[input.clustername == input.clustername[0]].copy()
687        input['date']=pd.to_datetime(input["date"])
688        input["dayofyear"]=input.date.dt.dayofyear
689        input['year']=input.date.dt.year
690        input['cases'] = input[input_field]
691
692        K = 2*input[input_field].max()
693        #drop bissextile fine tuning in needed in the future
694        input = input.loc[~(input['date'].dt.month.eq(2) & input['date'].dt.day.eq(29))].reset_index(drop=True)
695        input["dayofyear_angle"] = input["dayofyear"]*2 * np.pi/365
696        input["r_baseline"] = input.apply(lambda x : ((x["year"]-2020)*2 * np.pi + x["dayofyear_angle"])*K,axis=1)
697        size_factor = 16
698        input["r_cas_sup"] = input.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] + 0.5*x[input_field]*size_factor,axis=1)
699        input["r_cas_inf"] = input.apply(lambda x : x["r_baseline"] - 0.5*x[input_field]*size_factor,axis=1)
700
701        radius = 200
702        def polar(theta,r,norm=radius/input["r_baseline"].max()):
703            x = norm*r*np.cos(theta)
704            y = norm*r*np.sin(theta)
705            return x,y
706        x_base,y_base=polar(input["dayofyear_angle"],input["r_baseline"])
707        x_cas_sup,y_cas_sup=polar(input["dayofyear_angle"],input["r_cas_sup"])
708        x_cas_inf,y_cas_inf=polar(input["dayofyear_angle"],input["r_cas_inf"])
709
710        xcol,ycol=[],[]
711        [ xcol.append([i,j]) for i,j in zip(x_cas_inf,x_cas_sup)]
712        [ ycol.append([i,j]) for i,j in zip(y_cas_inf,y_cas_sup)]
713        standardfig.patches(xcol,ycol,color='blue',fill_alpha = 0.5)
714
715        src = ColumnDataSource(data=dict(
716        x=x_base,
717        y=y_base,
718        date=input['date'],
719        cases=input['cases']
720        ))
721        standardfig.line( x = 'x', y = 'y', source = src, legend_label = input.clustername[0],
722                        line_width = 3, line_color = 'blue')
723        circle = standardfig.circle('x', 'y', size=2, source=src)
724
725        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
726        hover_tool = HoverTool(tooltips=[('Cases', '@cases{0,0.0}'), ('date', '@date{%F}')],
727                               formatters={'Cases': 'printf', '@{cases}': cases_custom, '@date': 'datetime'},
728                               renderers=[circle],
729                               point_policy="snap_to_data")
730        standardfig.add_tools(hover_tool)
731
732        outer_radius=250
733        [standardfig.annular_wedge(
734            x=0, y=0, inner_radius=0, outer_radius=outer_radius, start_angle=i*np.pi/6,\
735            end_angle=(i+1)*np.pi/6,fill_color=None,line_color='black',line_dash='dotted')
736        for i in range(12)]
737
738        label = ['January','February','March','April','May','June','July','August','September','October','November','December']
739        xr,yr = polar(np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, 13),outer_radius,1)
740        standardfig.text(xr[:-1], yr[:-1], label,text_font_size="9pt", text_align="center", text_baseline="middle")
741
742        standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
743        standardfig.legend.location = "top_left"
744        standardfig.legend.click_policy="hide"
745        return standardfig
@decowrapper
@decoplot
def pycoa_scrollingmenu(self, input=None, input_field=None, **kwargs): 
748    @decowrapper
749    @decoplot
750    def pycoa_scrollingmenu(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
751        '''
752        -----------------
753        Create a date plot, with a scrolling menu location, according to arguments.
754        See help(pycoa_scrollingmenu).
755        Keyword arguments
756        -----------------
757        len(location) > 2
758        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
759        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
760        - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
761        - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
762        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
763        - title = None
764        - textcopyright = default
765        - mode = mouse
766        -guideline = False
767        - cursor_date = None if True
768                - orientation = horizontal
769        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
770                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
771                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
772                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
773                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
774        '''
775        mode = kwargs.get('mode',self.dvisu_default['mode'])
776        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
777
778        uniqloc = input.clustername.unique().to_list()
779        uniqloc.sort()
780        if 'where' in input.columns:
781            if len(uniqloc) < 2:
782                raise CoaTypeError('What do you want me to do ? You have selected, only one country.'
783                                   'There is no sens to use this method. See help.')
784        input = input[['date', 'clustername', input_field]]
785        input = input.sort_values(by='clustername', ascending = True).reset_index(drop=True)
786
787        mypivot = pd.pivot_table(input, index='date', columns='clustername', values=input_field)
788        column_order = uniqloc
789        mypivot = mypivot.reindex(column_order, axis=1)
790        source = ColumnDataSource(mypivot)
791
792        filter_data1 = mypivot[[uniqloc[0]]].rename(columns={uniqloc[0]: 'cases'})
793        src1 = ColumnDataSource(filter_data1)
794
795        filter_data2 = mypivot[[uniqloc[1]]].rename(columns={uniqloc[1]: 'cases'})
796        src2 = ColumnDataSource(filter_data2)
797
798        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
799        hover_tool = HoverTool(tooltips=[('Cases', '@cases{0,0.0}'), ('date', '@date{%F}')],
800                               formatters={'Cases': 'printf', '@{cases}': cases_custom, '@date': 'datetime'}, mode = mode,
801                               point_policy="snap_to_data")  # ,PanTool())
802
803        panels = []
804        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
805            standardfig = self.standardfig( y_axis_type = axis_type, x_axis_type = 'datetime', **kwargs)
806
807            standardfig.yaxis[0].formatter = PrintfTickFormatter(format = "%4.2e")
808
809            standardfig.add_tools(hover_tool)
810            if guideline:
811                cross= CrosshairTool()
812                standardfig.add_tools(cross)
813            def add_line(src, options, init, color):
814                s = Select(options = options, value = init)
815                r = standardfig.line(x = 'date', y = 'cases', source = src, line_width = 3, line_color = color)
816                li = LegendItem(label = init, renderers = [r])
817                s.js_on_change('value', CustomJS(args=dict(s0=source, s1=src, li=li),
818                                                 code="""
819                                            var c = cb_obj.value;
820                                            var y = s0.data[c];
821                                            s1.data['cases'] = y;
822                                            li.label = {value: cb_obj.value};
823                                            s1.change.emit();
824                                     """))
825                return s, li
826
827            s1, li1 = add_line(src1, uniqloc, uniqloc[0], self.scolors[0])
828            s2, li2 = add_line(src2, uniqloc, uniqloc[1], self.scolors[1])
829            standardfig.add_layout(Legend(items = [li1, li2]))
830            standardfig.legend.location = 'top_left'
831            layout = row(column(row(s1, s2), row(standardfig)))
832            panel = Panel(child = layout, title = axis_type)
833            panels.append(panel)
834
835        tabs = Tabs(tabs = panels)
836        label = standardfig.title
837        return tabs

Create a date plot, with a scrolling menu location, according to arguments. See help(pycoa_scrollingmenu).

Keyword arguments

len(location) > 2

  • input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
  • input_field = if None take second element could be a list
  • plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
  • plot_width = width_height_default[0]
  • title = None
  • textcopyright = default
  • mode = mouse -guideline = False
  • cursor_date = None if True
    • orientation = horizontal
  • when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame. Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy. when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy] if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
@decowrapper
@decoplot
def pycoa_yearly_plot(self, input=None, input_field=None, **kwargs): 
840    @decowrapper
841    @decoplot
842    def pycoa_yearly_plot(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
843        '''
844        -----------------
845        Create a date plot according to arguments. See help(pycoa_date_plot).
846        Keyword arguments
847        -----------------
848        - input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory
849        |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
850        - input_field = if None take second element could be a list
851        - plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
852        - plot_width = width_height_default[0]
853        - title = None
854        - textcopyright = default
855        - mode = mouse
856        - guideline = False
857        - cursor_date = None if True
858                - orientation = horizontal
859        - when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame.
860                 Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy.
861                 when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy]
862                 if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to
863                 if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
864        '''
865        guideline = kwargs.get('guideline',self.dvisu_default['guideline'])
866        if len(input.clustername.unique()) > 1 :
867            print('Can only display yearly plot for ONE location. I took the first one:', input.clustername[0])
868        input = input.loc[input.clustername == input.clustername[0]].copy()
869
870        panels = []
871        listfigs = []
872        cases_custom = CocoDisplay.rollerJS()
873        input['date']=pd.to_datetime(input["date"])
874        #drop bissextile fine tuning in needed in the future
875        input = input.loc[~(input['date'].dt.month.eq(2) & input['date'].dt.day.eq(29))].reset_index(drop=True)
876        input = input.copy()
877        input.loc[:,'allyears']=input['date'].apply(lambda x : x.year)
878        input['allyears'] = input['allyears'].astype(int)
879        input.loc[:,'dayofyear']= input['date'].apply(lambda x : x.dayofyear)
880        allyears = list(input.allyears.unique())
881        if isinstance(input['rolloverdisplay'].iloc[0],list):
882            input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
883        if len(input_field)>1:
884            CoaError('Only one variable could be displayed')
885        else:
886            input_field=input_field[0]
887        for axis_type in self.ax_type:
888            standardfig = self.standardfig( y_axis_type = axis_type,**kwargs)
889            i = 0
890            r_list=[]
891            maxou=-1000
892            input['cases']=input[input_field]
893            line_style = ['solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'dotdash']
894            colors = itertools.cycle(self.lcolors)
895            for loc in list(input.clustername.unique()):
896                for year in allyears:
897                    input_filter = input.loc[(input.clustername == loc) & (input['date'].dt.year.eq(year))].reset_index(drop = True)
898                    src = ColumnDataSource(input_filter)
899                    leg = loc + ' ' + str(year)
900                    r = standardfig.line(x = 'dayofyear', y = input_field, source = src,
901                                     color = next(colors), line_width = 3,
902                                     legend_label = leg,
903                                     hover_line_width = 4, name = input_field)
904                    maxou=max(maxou,np.nanmax(input_filter[input_field].values))
905
906            label = input_field
907            tooltips = [('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), ('Cases', '@cases{0,0.0}')]
908            formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@date': 'datetime', '@name': 'printf'}
909            hover=HoverTool(tooltips = tooltips, formatters = formatters, point_policy = "snap_to_data", mode = kwargs['mode'])  # ,PanTool())
910            standardfig.add_tools(hover)
911            if guideline:
912                cross= CrosshairTool()
913                standardfig.add_tools(cross)
914
915            if axis_type == 'linear':
916                if maxou  < 1e4 :
917                    standardfig.yaxis.formatter = BasicTickFormatter(use_scientific=False)
918
919            standardfig.legend.label_text_font_size = "12px"
920            panel = Panel(child=standardfig, title = axis_type)
921            panels.append(panel)
922            standardfig.legend.background_fill_alpha = 0.6
923
924            standardfig.legend.location = "top_left"
925            standardfig.legend.click_policy="hide"
926
927            labelspd=input.loc[(input.allyears.eq(2021)) & (input.date.dt.day.eq(1))]
928            standardfig.xaxis.ticker = list(labelspd['dayofyear'].astype(int))
929            replacelabelspd =  labelspd['date'].apply(lambda x: str(x.strftime("%b")))
930            #label_dict = dict(zip(input.loc[input.allyears.eq(2020)]['daymonth'],input.loc[input.allyears.eq(2020)]['date'].apply(lambda x: str(x.day)+'/'+str(x.month))))
931            standardfig.xaxis.major_label_overrides = dict(zip(list(labelspd['dayofyear'].astype(int)),list(replacelabelspd)))
932
933            CocoDisplay.bokeh_legend(standardfig)
934            listfigs.append(standardfig)
935
936        tooltips = [('where', '@rolloverdisplay'), ('date', '@date{%F}'), (r.name, '@$name{0,0.0}')]
937        formatters = {'where': 'printf', '@date': 'datetime', '@name': 'printf'}
938        hover=HoverTool(tooltips = tooltips, formatters = formatters, point_policy = "snap_to_data", mode = kwargs['mode'], renderers=[r])  # ,PanTool())
939        standardfig.add_tools(hover)
940        if guideline:
941            cross= CrosshairTool()
942            standardfig.add_tools(cross)
943        self.set_listfigures(listfigs)
944        tabs = Tabs(tabs = panels)
945        return tabs

Create a date plot according to arguments. See help(pycoa_date_plot).

Keyword arguments

  • input = None : if None take first element. A DataFrame with a Pycoa struture is mandatory |location|date|Variable desired|daily|cumul|weekly|codelocation|clustername|permanentdisplay|rolloverdisplay|
  • input_field = if None take second element could be a list
  • plot_heigh= width_height_default[1]
  • plot_width = width_height_default[0]
  • title = None
  • textcopyright = default
  • mode = mouse
  • guideline = False
  • cursor_date = None if True
    • orientation = horizontal
  • when : default min and max according to the inpude DataFrame. Dates are given under the format dd/mm/yyyy. when format [dd/mm/yyyy : dd/mm/yyyy] if [:dd/mm/yyyy] min date up to if [dd/mm/yyyy:] up to max date
def decohistomap(func): 
 948    def decohistomap(func):
 949        """
 950        Decorator function used for histogram and map
 951        """
 952        @wraps(func)
 953        def inner_hm(self, input = None, input_field = None, **kwargs):
 954
 955            tile = kwargs.get('tile', self.dvisu_default['tile'])
 956
 957            maplabel = kwargs.get('maplabel', None)
 958            if maplabel :
 959                if not isinstance(maplabel,list):
 960                    maplabel=[maplabel]
 961            #if maplabel:
 962            #    maplabel = maplabel
 963
 964            if 'map' in func.__name__:
 965                kwargs['maplabel'] = maplabel
 966
 967            orientation = kwargs.get('orientation', self.dvisu_default['orientation'])
 968            cursor_date = kwargs.get('cursor_date', None)
 969            #if orientation:
 970            #    kwargs['orientation'] = orientation
 971            #kwargs['cursor_date'] = kwargs.get('cursor_date',  self.dvisu_default['cursor_date'])
 972            if isinstance(input['where'].iloc[0],list):
 973                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['clustername']
 974                input = input.explode('where')
 975            else:
 976                input['rolloverdisplay'] = input['where']
 977
 978            uniqloc = input.clustername.unique()
 979
 980            geopdwd = input
 981            if type(geopdwd) != gpd.geodataframe.GeoDataFrame:
 982                if maplabel and 'unsorted' in maplabel:
 983                    pass
 984                else:
 985                    geopdwd = geopdwd.sort_values(by=input_field, ascending = False).reset_index(drop=True)
 986
 987                started = geopdwd.date.min()
 988                ended = geopdwd.date.max()
 989                if cursor_date:
 990                    date_slider = DateSlider(title = "Date: ", start = started, end = ended,
 991                                         value = started, step=24 * 60 * 60 * 1000, orientation = orientation)
 992                    #wanted_date = date_slider.value_as_datetime.date()
 993
 994                #if func.__name__ == 'pycoa_mapfolium' or func.__name__ == 'pycoa_map' or func.__name__ == 'innerdecomap' or func.__name__ == 'innerdecopycoageo':
 995                if func.__name__ in ['pycoa_mapfolium','pycoa_map','pycoageo' ,'pycoa_pimpmap']:
 996                    if isinstance(input['where'].iloc[0],list):
 997                        geom = self.location_geometry
 998                        geodic={}
 999                        for uclust in geopdwd['clustername'].unique():
1000                            loc = geopdwd.loc[geopdwd.clustername==uclust]['where'].iloc[0]
1001                            cumulgeo = list(geom.loc[geom['where'].isin(loc)]['geometry'])
1002                            geodic[uclust]=cumulgeo
1003                        #geodic={loc:geom.loc[geom['where']==loc]['geometry'].values[0] for loc in geopdwd['where'].unique()}
1004                        geopdwd.loc[:,'geometry'] = geopdwd.clustername.map(geodic)
1005                    else:
1006                        geopdwd = pd.merge(geopdwd, self.location_geometry, on='where')
1007                    kwargs['tile'] = tile
1008                    if self.iso3country in ['FRA','USA']:
1009                        geo = copy.deepcopy(self.geo)
1010                        d = geo._list_translation
1011                        if func.__name__ != 'pycoa_mapfolium':
1012                            if any(i in list(geopdwd.codelocation.unique()) for i in d.keys()) \
1013                            or any(True for i in d.keys() if ''.join(list(geopdwd.codelocation.unique())).find(i)!=-1):
1014                                if maplabel:
1015                                    if 'dense' in maplabel:
